{"actual":"","id":"54ae5da6e4b08621addd287a","key":"<h2 class=\"iCIMS_SubHeader iCIMS_SubHeader_Job\">\nMore information about this job:\n</h2>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"iCIMS_InfoMsg iCIMS_InfoField_Job\">\nOverview:\n</div>\n<div class=\"iCIMS_InfoMsg iCIMS_InfoMsg_Job\">\n<div class=\"iCIMS_Expandable_Container\">\n<div class=\"iCIMS_Expandable_Text\">\n<p style=\"margin: 0px\">&nbsp;</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\"><strong>About the Position:</strong></p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">CubeSmart (NYSE:&nbsp; CUBE) is seeking a Senior Pricing and Business Intelligence Analyst to join its strategic Business Intelligence and Revenue Management team, which is responsible for driving significant revenue growth and operational efficiencies through advanced pricing analytics, forecast modeling, marketing automation, and ad hoc analytics that span all functions of the Company.&nbsp; The ideal candidate will have graduate-level training (MS/PhD) in a quantitative discipline (Operations Research, Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics) and the ability both to work independently and to interface effectively with technical and non-technical colleagues.</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\"><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p style=\"margin: 0px\"><strong>About CubeSmart:</strong></p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">CubeSmart is a publicly traded real estate investment trust (REIT) focused on the development, acquisition, disposition, and management of self-storage facilities.&nbsp; CubeSmart is headquartered in Malvern, PA, a suburb of Philadelphia, and is one of the largest self-storage owners and operators in the United States, with more than 530 locations nationwide.&nbsp;</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">&nbsp;</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">Self-storage is inherently an attractive business, characterized by a stable demand profile and attractive cash flow characteristics.&nbsp; Historically, self-storage has been the best performing institutional real estate property type.&nbsp; The industry is widely fragmented, creating significant long-term growth opportunities for large operators, such as CubeSmart, that have significant scale and sophistication advantages over smaller operators, as well as broad access to capital to support continued industry consolidation.</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">&nbsp;</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">Over the past five years, CubeSmart has grown significantly, acquiring more than $1.5 billion in assets. &nbsp;In 2013, the Company produced more than $300 million in revenue, while generating a 23% increase in FFO (funds from operations) per share.</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">&nbsp;</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">Our growth is possible because of our 1,600 teammates across the country who work together to grow the company, serve our Customers, and deliver results through a culture of open</p>\n<div id=\"iCIMS_Expandable_Button\"></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"iCIMS_InfoMsg iCIMS_InfoField_Job\">\nResponsibilities:\n</div>\n<div class=\"iCIMS_InfoMsg iCIMS_InfoMsg_Job\" itemprop=\"responsibilities\">\n<div class=\"iCIMS_Expandable_Container\">\n<div class=\"iCIMS_Expandable_Text\">\n<ul><li>Lead the continued enhancement of the Company’s revenue management system, interfacing with both internal and external analytical and development resources</li><li>Own the development of demand forecasting and optimization models</li><li>Assist in the definition, implementation, and refinement of all downstream business applications of any forecasting output, including primary application in the Company’s proprietary revenue management system</li><li>Design, implement, and evaluate statistical testing protocol for website, call center, and pricing optimization</li><li>Present business/demand trend information to the senior management team to inform strategic decision making</li><li>Engage with internal stakeholders, external marketing agencies, consultants, and IT resources to facilitate the collection and interpretation of operational data</li></ul>\n<div id=\"iCIMS_Expandable_Button\"></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"iCIMS_InfoMsg iCIMS_InfoField_Job\">\nQualifications:\n</div>\n<div class=\"iCIMS_InfoMsg iCIMS_InfoMsg_Job\" Research, Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics) with 1-5 years of relevant professional experience (including relevant internship/externship experience)</div></li><li>Strong background in applied statistics (regression analysis), microeconomics (discrete choice modeling) and mathematical optimization</li><li>Proficient technical programmer (e.g., SQL, MatLab, R, Excel/VBA, C++, Python, etc.) and statistical analysis experience working with large datasets</li><li>Some exposure to revenue management and dynamic pricing is a plus</li><li>Ability to work independently and interface effectively with both technical and non-technical colleagues</li><li>Strong written and verbal communication skills are essential</li></ul>\n"}

a feeling of complete trust, security, and satisfaction through demonstrations of competence and willingness to serve. </span></li><li><span style=\"font-family: arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size: small\">All departmental spaces to include housekeeping supply and administrative spaces are to be kept in accordance with the Aramark and the facility standards of cleanliness and appearance; all equipment clean, labeled and kept in good repair. </span></li><li><span style=\"font-family: arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size: small\">Recognizes and adopts activities appropriate to the specific needs of the patient/resident population; environment.</strong></li><br/>- You will be accountable for engineering of the Industrial Cloud infrastructure framework in support of the software platform, with a focus on delivery of automated {"actual":"","id":"54ae5da6e4b08621addd2887","key":"<h2 class=\"iCIMS_SubHeader iCIMS_SubHeader_Job\">\nMore information about this job:\n</h2>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"iCIMS_InfoMsg iCIMS_InfoField_Job\">\nOverview:\n</div>\n<div class=\"iCIMS_InfoMsg iCIMS_InfoMsg_Job\">\n<div class=\"iCIMS_Expandable_Container\">\n<div class=\"iCIMS_Expandable_Text\">\n<p style=\"margin: 0px\">Are you looking for an opportunity to grow your career and to make a difference?&nbsp; Are you eager to take on more responsibility, enhance your current skill-set and learn from the best in the business?&nbsp; Are you flexible geographically and able to relocate?&nbsp; If this describes you, then this District Manager in Training position at CubeSmart may be for you.</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">&nbsp;</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">We are looking for experienced, successful managers from service related industries that have strong analytical and problem solving abilities.&nbsp; While running the daily operations of one of our facilities, you will simultaneously participate in an intensive six to twelve month training program to acquire operational and managerial knowledge, learn what it takes to have outstanding store performance, and gain exposure to every aspect of CubeSmart’s business.&nbsp; Upon successful completion of the program, the District Manager in Training will be provided with the opportunity to become a District Manager.</p>\n<div id=\"iCIMS_Expandable_Button\"></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"iCIMS_InfoMsg iCIMS_InfoField_Job\">\nResponsibilities:\n</div>\n<div class=\"iCIMS_InfoMsg iCIMS_InfoMsg_Job\" itemprop=\"responsibilities\">\n<div class=\"iCIMS_Expandable_Container\">\n<div class=\"iCIMS_Expandable_Text\">\n<p style=\"margin: 0px\">The District Manager in Training (DMT) program will be focused on four strategic areas; (i) store performance, (ii) developing a strong operational knowledge base, (iii) developing strong leadership and management traits and (iv) real-life experience while witnessing and applying their knowledge in these identified strategic areas. By the completion of the program, the DMT will be eligible to be considered for a District Manager position in which they would oversee a territory of stores.&nbsp; The ability to relocate when offered a District Manager role is essential.</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">&nbsp;</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">In addition to the robust training program provided, the District Manager in Training plays a key role in the management of our business and will initially operate as a General Manager in order to more fully understand CubeSmart’s processes and culture.&nbsp; Responsibilities as a GM include:</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">&nbsp;</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">Deliver the “WOW!” service model and personally interact with Customers and sales leads on a regular basis both over the phone and in person.</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">&nbsp;</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">Sell merchandise including packing/moving supplies, locks, and insurance to protect Customers’ goods.</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">&nbsp;</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">Responsible for daily operations and maintenance of a store location including but not limited to: utilizing POS system, conduct space audits and maintain cleanliness of store, accurately maintain store spending, coordinate auctions, produce reports and perform light repair as needed.</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">&nbsp;</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">Provide support to store employees to enhance sales and service performance, operational effectiveness, and store maintenance.</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">&nbsp;</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">Understand and participate in monthly review of P&amp;L statements with District Manager and store team.</p>\n<div id=\"iCIMS_Expandable_Button\"></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"iCIMS_InfoMsg iCIMS_InfoField_Job\">\nQualifications:\n</div>\n<div class=\"iCIMS_InfoMsg iCIMS_InfoMsg_Job\" itemprop=\"qualifications\">\n<div class=\"iCIMS_Expandable_Container\">\n<div class=\"iCIMS_Expandable_Text\">\n<p style=\"margin: 0px\">This opportunity is not for everyone, but rather for those select individuals who are ambitious, career-driven, maintain a strong work ethic, hold themselves to high standards, maintain the highest of ethical values and have a strong belief that Customers (both internal and external) are the number one priority.</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">&nbsp;</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">The following requirements must be met to be considered for this role:</p><ul><li>Minimum&nbsp;of 5 years progressively successful employment, preferably in service&nbsp;related industry</li><li>Proven ability to lead, develop and coach people; direct supervisorial experience&nbsp;preferred</li><li>Four year&nbsp;Bachelor degree in business or related field preferred; Associate’s degree&nbsp;or equivalent experience required</li><li>Successful track&nbsp;record growing revenue, managing budgets and P&amp;L's of at least $1&nbsp;million in annual revenue</li><li>Excellent interpersonal and written and verbal communication skills</li><li>Strong&nbsp;analytical and problem solving abilities</li><li>Able&nbsp;to prioritize multiple projects, meet By the completion of the program, the DMT will be eligible to be considered for a District Manager position in which they would oversee a territory of stores.&nbsp; The ability to relocate when offered a District Manager role is essential.</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">&nbsp;</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">In addition to the robust training program provided, the District Manager in Training plays a key role in the management of our business and will initially operate as a General Manager in order to more fully understand CubeSmart’s processes and culture.&nbsp; Responsibilities as a GM include:</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">&nbsp;</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">Deliver the “WOW!” service model and personally interact with Customers and sales leads on a regular basis both over the phone and in person.</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">&nbsp;</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">Sell merchandise including packing/moving supplies, locks, and insurance to protect Customers’ goods.</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">&nbsp;</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">Responsible for daily operations and maintenance of a store location including but not limited to: utilizing POS system, conduct space audits and maintain cleanliness of store, accurately maintain store spending, coordinate auctions, produce reports and perform light repair as needed.</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">&nbsp;</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">Provide support to store employees to enhance sales and service performance, operational effectiveness, and store maintenance.</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">&nbsp;</p><p style=\"margin: 0px\">Understand and participate in monthly review of P&amp;L statements with District Manager and store team.</p>\n<div id=\"iCIMS_Expandable_Button\"></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"iCIMS_InfoMsg iCIMS_InfoField_Job\">\nQualifications:\n</div>\n<div class=\"iCIMS_InfoMsg iCIMS_InfoMsg_Job\" itemprop=\"qualifications\">\n<div class=\"iCIMS_Expandable_Container\">\n<div widely fragmented, creating significant long-term growth opportunities for large operators, such as CubeSmart, that have significant scale and sophistication advantages over smaller operators, as well Everyday we provide workplace, facility, and business support service solutions to a client base encompassing a wide range of environments including but not limited to automotive, life sciences, technology, industrial, manufacturing, and corporate campuses. We are uniquely positioned to integrate a variety of diverse business support functions into a single solution set we often self perform. Our B&amp;I FS solution sets are process based, metric driven and integrates technology to manage and report outcome based performance.</span></p><p style=\"margin: 0px\"><span style=\"font-family: arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size: small\"> </span></p><p style=\"margin: 0px\"><span style=\"font-family: arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size: small\"> </span></p><p style=\"margin: 0px\"><span style=\"font-family: arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size: small\">As a Manager you will be responsible for providing direction for logistical movement services at the highest possible standard of quality. You will have responsibility for staffing, scheduling, training and developing an hourly staff in addition to handling customer and client requests as they pertain to your department. You will manage about 20 full-time employees.  </span></p><p style=\"margin: 0px\"><span style=\"font-family: arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size: small\"> </span></p><p style=\"margin: 0px\"><span style=\"font-family: arial,helvetica,sans-serif; Innovative chemical dependency treatment has been the hallmark of Starlite Recovery Center for over 3 decades. Our professional staff of physicians, counselors, and nurses provides clients with an interdisciplinary team that effectively manages their individualized care. Starlite views chemical dependency as a primary disease, one which is progressive and potentially fatal. It may severely impair functioning in all major life areas. Starlite provides programs that deliver a comprehensive, individualized continuum of care for chemically dependent persons and/or their family members who have been affected by the diseases of alcoholism and/or drug addiction. </p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>The <b>Counselor </b>is responsible for providing individual and group therapy to chemically dependent adult patients.&nbsp; Maintain proper documentation as required by state and federal standards.&nbsp; Is a active member of the interdisciplincary treatment team.&nbsp; Develops and presents didactic materials to patients.&nbsp; Conducts back-to-work and back-to-home conferences as needed.&nbsp; Plans aftercare for assigned patients.&nbsp; Provides family counseling as needed.<br>\n<br>\nFull time and PRN (as needed).</p></span> \n                                                <div id=\"jobDescriptionTextFade\"></div>\n                                            \n\t\t</div>\n                                        \n                                            <h2>Job Requirements</h2>\n                                            <div class=\"section-body\">\n                                                <span id=\"CBBody_Requirements\" itemprop=\"qualifications\"><span>Master's degree in behavioral health or related field preferred.&nbsp; At least 2 years’ experience specifically with chemically&nbsp;dependent/dually diagnosed population.&nbsp;Licensed in one of the following: LPC, LMSW, LCSW, LMFT, &nbsp;LCDC preferred. </span></span>\n                                            </div>\n                                        "}

{"actual":"","id":"556dd0f2e4b0afff2e7e0be8","key":"\n                                            <h2>Job Description</h2>\n                                            <div id=\"pnlJobDescription\" class=\"section-body\" itemprop=\"description\">\n\t\t\t\n                                                <span id=\"CBBody_Description\"><span>Dunmore&nbsp;Treatment Center, a member of&nbsp;Acadia Health, is an outpatient substance abuse treatment facility serving patients diagnosed with the disease of addiction specifically to the opioid class of drugs. Our facility has an opening for a full-time&nbsp;<strong><em><span style=\"text-decoration: underline\">RN</span></em></strong> Nursing Supervisor. The qualified candidate will work closely in a team environment with a team of medical, clinical, and office personnel in accordance with State and Federal Regulations to provide exceptional quality of care to our patients. We offer our patients an out-patient environment conducive to recovery from the disease of addiction, while we offer our staff an educational environment where patient care is our top priority.<br>\n<br>\nUnder the supervision of the Clinic Director, our Nursing Supervisor is ultimately responsible for the daily administration and supervision of the nursing department, including medication management. Additional responsibilities include:<br>\n&nbsp;1) Providing direct supervision to the nursing staff; 2) Actively participating in the interviewing, hiring, and onboarding process of new employees; 3) Providing orientation and ongoing training of medical staff; 4) Ensuring the medication room is in full compliance with all Clinic Policies, Federal and State Laws and Regulations at all times; 5) Reviewing and maintaining accurate medical records to ensure medical compliance with all Federal and State regulations; 6) Maintaining accurate daily financial records; 7) Ensuring the administration of medications as ordered by the Medical Director; 8) Coordinating and cooperating with local agencies and organizations necessary to expedite treatment for each patient.<br>\n<br>\n</span></span> \n                                                <div id=\"jobDescriptionTextFade\"></div>\n                                            \n\t\t</div>\n                                        \n                                            <h2>Job Requirements</h2>\n                                            <div class=\"section-body\">\n                                                <span id=\"CBBody_Requirements\" itemprop=\"qualifications\"><span>Qualifications: <br>\n1) Current&nbsp;Pennsylvania&nbsp; <strong><em><span style=\"text-decoration: underline\">RN</span></em></strong> license required; <br>\n2) Minimum of two years** experience managing others required; <br>\n3) Phlebotomy skills required; <br>\n4) Proficient in Microsoft Office applications, including, but not limited to: Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint; <br>\n5) Excellent verbal, non-verbal, and written communication skills; <br>\n6) Ability to work early morning hours with flexibility to cover shifts as needed; <br>\n7) Experience with chemical dependency and/or medication assisted treatment preferred.<br>\n8)<strong><em> MAT</em></strong> experience (resume must reflect <br>\n<br>\nAcadia&nbsp;Health offers a competitive benefits package to all full-time employees, including Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k, Company paid group term life insurance, supplemental life insurance and&nbsp;disability insurance.</span></span>\n                                            </div>\n                                        "}

{"actual":"","id":"556dd0f2e4b0afff2e7e0bee","key":"\n                                            <h2>Job Description</h2>\n                                            <div id=\"pnlJobDescription\" class=\"section-body\" itemprop=\"description\">\n\t\t\t\n                                                <span id=\"CBBody_Description\"><p style=\"text-align: center\" align=\"center\"></p><div><br></div><p>Abilene Behavioral Health is a center of excellence in the field of behavioral health care. Licensed by the Texas Department of State Health Services (TDSHS), accredited by the Joint Commission (TJC), the “gold standard' in quality care, and contracted with more than 20 managed care organizations, our programs are recognized for quality. Abilene Behavioral Health provides the most comprehensive and effective suite of behavioral health services in West Texas.<br><br><strong>Position Summary:</strong></p><p>The Human Resource Director will guide and manage the overall provision of Human Resources services, policies, and programs. &nbsp;This person to ensure legal compliance by monitoring and implementing applicable human resource federal and state compliance requirements, conducting investigations, maintaining records, representing the organization at hearings, employee safety, welfare, wellness and health, and other employee services.<br><br></p><p><strong>Key Responsibilities Include:</strong></p><ul>    <li>Conversion and implementation of Hospital Policies and Procedures.</li>    <li>Recruitment and staffing.</li>    <li>Performance management.</li>    <li>Development of an employee-oriented company culture that emphasizes patient care quality, continuous improvement, and high performance.</li>    <li>Oversee and assist with Joint Commission, CMS and state survey compliance.</li>    <li>Assist the leadership team in continually refining the role within to assist in achieving their operational and strategic goals.</li>    <li>Working within federal and state labor and employment laws, FMLA, HIPPA, ADA, COBRA and other regulatory laws required.</li>    <li>Providing leadership, guidance, and support in developing, implementing and reviewing Human Resource and leadership functions.</li>    <li>Identify and assist with training needs.</li></ul></span> \n                                                <div id=\"jobDescriptionTextFade\"></div>\n                                            \n\t\t</div>\n                                        \n                                            <h2>Job Requirements</h2>\n                                            <div class=\"section-body\">\n                                                <span id=\"CBBody_Requirements\" itemprop=\"qualifications\"><ul>    <li>BA Degree preferred.</li>    <li>Five years of HR Manager or Director experience in a Healthcare setting required.</li>    <li>Knowledge of hospital operations and the responsibilities of HR.</li>    <li>Experience with licensing entities such as Joint Commission, CMS and State surveys.</li>    <li>Working knowledge of Texas HR guidelines.</li></ul></span>\n                                            </div>\n                                        "}

{"actual":"","id":"556dd0f2e4b0afff2e7e0bef","key":"Nurse Practitioner"}
{"actual":"","id":"556dd0f2e4b0afff2e7e0bef","key":"Nurse"}
{"actual":"","id":"556dd0f2e4b0afff2e7e0bef","key":"\n                                            <h2>Job Description</h2>\n                                            <div id=\"pnlJobDescription\" class=\"section-body\" itemprop=\"description\">\n\t\t\t\n                                                <span id=\"CBBody_Description\"><hr>\n<center>\n<strong>Nurse Practitioner\n</strong>\n</center><hr>\n<strong>Qualifications:</strong><br>\n<br>\nUnder the supervision of the Director of Nursing, the Nurse Practitioner is responsible for providing patient care in a supportive and therapeutic environment.  The Nurse Practitioner coordinates with the physician and cooperates with other departments as required to provide for total patient care.<br>\n<br>\n<strong>ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS :</strong><br>\n<br>\n<ul>\n    <li>Responsible for securing a health and developmental history from the patient, records findings and makes critical evaluations.\n    </li>\n    <li>Request appropriate diagnostic testing.\n    </li>\n    <li>    Prescribes medications and treatments for illnesses.\n    </li>\n    <li>    Discriminates between normal and abnormal findings to recognize early stages of serious physical, emotional or mental problems.\n    </li>\n    <li>    Assists in the management of chronic health problems.\n    </li>\n    <li>    Teaches and demonstrates the application of good health practices to patients.\n    </li>\n    <li>   Maintains current clinical medical records to insure data is entered appropriately and accurately in accordance with White Deer Run policies and procedures.\n    </li>\n    <li>    Provides emergency services, in the absence of the physician, including primary care for trauma and other procedures.\n    </li>\n    <li>    Interprets prescriptions and dispenses products as prescribed.  Prior to dispensing the product the patient must be made aware of any synergistic, antagonistic or and cumulative effects.\n    </li>\n    <li>   Works collaboratively with the physician in planning, instituting, evaluating and revising care plans; assists in determining conditions, resources and policies essential to the delivery of health care services.\n    </li>\n    <li>   Evaluates total health care needs of the patient and develops a plan to meet these needs.  In addition, makes decisions concerning medical care needs of the patient with the physician as well as decisions regarding special needs.\n    </li>\n    <li> Provides comprehensive nursing care to patient, administering prescribed treatment and medications.       Assists the physician in performing more exhaustive diagnosis and treatments.\n    </li>\n    <li>Serves in a teaching capacity in the training and development of other health care personnel.\n    </li>\n    <li>   All other duties as assigned.\n    </li>\n</ul>\n<br>\n<strong>Additional information</strong><br>\n<br>\nHours: Must be able to work M-TH (8am-12pm each day)<br></span> \n                                                <div id=\"jobDescriptionTextFade\"></div>\n                                            \n\t\t</div>\n                                        \n                                            <h2>Job Requirements</h2>\n                                            <div class=\"section-body\">\n                                                <span id=\"CBBody_Requirements\" itemprop=\"qualifications\"><hr>\n<center>\n<strong>Nurse Practitioner\n</strong>\n</center><hr>\n<strong>Prefer experience in chemical dependency or psychiatric nursing.Education &amp; Training</strong><br>\n<br>\nProfessional knowledge of health care principles, practices and procedures obtained through an accredited Nurse Practitioner training program.<br>\n<br>\n<strong>Licensure, Certification &amp; Registration</strong><br>\n<br>\n<ul>\n    <li>Licensure as a Nurse Practitioner in the state of Oregon.\n    </li>\n    <li>CPR Certification.\n    </li>\n</ul>\n<br>\n<strong>Other Requirements</strong><br>\n<br>\n<ul>\n    <li>Good verbal and written communications skills.\n    </li>\n    <li>Ability to understand medical charts and physician orders.\n    </li>\n    <li>Good organizational skills.\n    </li>\n    <li>Effective communication skills with patients, staff, physicians, families and the public.\n    </li>\n    <li>Ability to be flexible in adjusting to new and rapidly changing situations.\n    </li>\n    <li>Must have ability to remain calm in emergency situations.\n    </li>\n    <li>Ability to work well with others as a member of a team.\n    </li>\n</ul>\n<br></span>\n                                            </div>\n                                        "}

The Nurse Practitioner coordinates with the physician and cooperates with other departments as required to provide for total patient care.<br>\n<br>\n<strong>ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS :</strong><br>\n<br>\n<ul>\n    <li>Responsible for securing a health and developmental history from the patient, records findings and makes critical evaluations.\n    </li>\n    <li>Request appropriate diagnostic testing.\n    </li>\n    <li>    Prescribes medications and treatments for illnesses.\n    </li>\n    <li>    Discriminates between normal and abnormal findings to recognize early stages of serious physical, emotional or mental problems.\n    </li>\n    <li>    Assists in the management of chronic health problems.\n    </li>\n    <li>    Teaches and demonstrates the application of good health practices to patients.\n    </li>\n    <li>   Maintains current clinical medical records to insure data is entered appropriately and accurately in accordance with White Deer Run policies and procedures.\n    </li>\n    <li>    Provides emergency services, in the absence of the physician, including primary care for trauma and other procedures.\n    </li>\n    <li>    Interprets prescriptions and dispenses products as prescribed.  Prior to dispensing the product the patient must be made aware of any synergistic, antagonistic or and cumulative effects.\n    </li>\n    <li>   Works collaboratively with the physician in planning, instituting, evaluating and revising care plans; assists in determining conditions, resources and policies essential to the delivery of health care services.\n    </li>\n    <li>   Evaluates total health care needs of the patient and develops a plan to meet these needs.  In addition, makes decisions concerning medical care needs of the patient with the physician as well as decisions regarding special needs.\n    </li>\n    <li> Provides comprehensive nursing care to patient, administering prescribed treatment and medications.       Assists the physician in performing more exhaustive diagnosis and treatments.\n    </li>\n    <li>Serves in a teaching capacity in the training and development of other health care personnel.\n    </li>\n    <li>   All other duties as assigned.\n    </li>\n</ul>\n<br>\n<strong>Additional information</strong><br>\n<br>\nHours: Must be able to work M-TH (8am-12pm each day)<br></span> \n                                                <div id=\"jobDescriptionTextFade\"></div>\n                                            \n\t\t</div>\n                                        \n                                            <h2>Job Requirements</h2>\n                                            <div class=\"section-body\">\n                                                <span id=\"CBBody_Requirements\" itemprop=\"qualifications\"><hr>\n<center>\n<strong>Nurse Practitioner\n</strong>\n</center><hr>\n<strong>Prefer experience in chemical dependency or psychiatric nursing.Education &amp; Training</strong><br>\n<br>\nProfessional knowledge of health care principles, practices and procedures obtained through an accredited Nurse Practitioner training program.<br>\n<br>\n<strong>Licensure, Certification &amp; Registration</strong><br>\n<br>\n<ul>\n    <li>Licensure as a Nurse Practitioner in the state of Oregon.\n    </li>\n    <li>CPR Certification.\n    </li>\n</ul>\n<br>\n<strong>Other Requirements</strong><br>\n<br>\n<ul>\n    <li>Good verbal and written communications skills.\n    </li>\n    <li>Ability to understand medical charts and physician orders.\n    </li>\n    <li>Good organizational skills.\n    </li>\n    <li>Effective communication skills with patients, staff, physicians, families and the public.\n    </li>\n    <li>Ability to be flexible in adjusting to new and rapidly changing situations.\n    </li>\n    <li>Must have ability to remain calm in emergency situations.\n    </li>\n    <li>Ability to work well with others as a member of a team.\n    </li>\n</ul>\n<br></span>\n                                            </div>\n                                        "}

{"actual":"","id":"556dd0f2e4b0afff2e7e0bf5","key":"Health Care"}
{"actual":"","id":"556dd0f2e4b0afff2e7e0bf5","key":"\n                                            <h2>Job Description</h2>\n                                            <div id=\"pnlJobDescription\" class=\"section-body\" itemprop=\"description\">\n\t\t\t\n                                                <span id=\"CBBody_Description\">White Deer Run is proud to be the premier provider of treatment for drug and alcohol addiction in Pennsylvania.&nbsp; We have immediate openings on all 3 shifts for Security Guards / Technicians to work at our Allenwood, PA facility. <br>\n<br>\n<strong>PURPOSE:<br>\n</strong><br>\n<p>Under the supervision of the Safety Supervisor, the Security Guard /&nbsp;Technician is responsible for monitoring any and all persons and/or vehicles entering or leaving facility property.&nbsp; The Security Guard / Technician is responsible for providing support to all staff as needed to ensure that a safe environment is maintained.&nbsp; This position&nbsp;is also responsible for daily safety and security communications to shift supervisors, and to maintain a “vehicle and events\" logbook used to formally communicate information to shift supervisors and management staff.<br>\n<br>\n<strong>ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:<br>\n</strong><br>\n<span>1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Assists, directs and monitors all persons entering and leaving facility property.</p>\n<p><span>2)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Keeps an accurate vehicle log book.</p>\n<p><span>3)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Directs emergency personnel arriving on facility and also maintains flow of traffic during emergencies. (i.e. Fire drills).</p>\n<p><span>4)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Communicates all incoming admissions, visits, deliveries and family program to appropriate staff on shift.</p>\n<p><span>5)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Assists with storage and retrieval of patient belongings as defined by the facility’s procedural guidelines.</p>\n<p><span>6)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Visually inspect all vehicles and informs persons of contraband rules.</p>\n<p><span>7)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Communicates to the supervisor(s) responsible, information about patients and staff who violate safety/security policies and/or practices.</p>\n<p><span>8)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Participates in shift reports with other supervisors and/or charge nurse.</p>\n<p><span>9)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>All other duties as assigned.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p><b></b></p>\n<p><b></b></p>\n<p><b></b></p>\n<p><b>OTHER FUNCTIONS</b>:</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p><span>1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>May be required to assist in the transportation of clients as needed on an emergency basis.</p>\n<p><span>2)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>May be required to work overtime in cases of inclement weather, call offs and/or other emergency situations.</p></span> \n                                                <div id=\"jobDescriptionTextFade\"></div>\n                                            \n\t\t</div>\n                                        \n                                            <h2>Job Requirements</h2>\n                                            <div class=\"section-body\">\n                                                <span id=\"CBBody_Requirements\" itemprop=\"qualifications\"><p><strong>JOB QUALIFICATIONS:<br>\n<br>\nExperience:</strong>&nbsp;&nbsp; <br>\nSecurity operations experience preferred.<br>\n<br>\n<strong>Education:</strong>&nbsp; <br>\nHigh school diploma or GED required.<br>\n<br>\n<strong>Licensure:</strong>&nbsp; <br>\nValid U.S. driver's license required.<br>\nAcceptable driving record required.<br>\nMust be at least 21 years of age.<br>\n<br>\n<strong>Other requirements:<br>\n</strong></p>\n<p><span>Needs physical mobility in order to monitor visitor activity.</span></p>\n<p><span>Good verbal and written communications skills.</span></p>\n<p>Must be able to successfully communicate with patients and all visitors, with respect and in a professional manner.</p>\n<p>Willingness to be flexible in adjusting to new and changing situations.</p>\n<p><br>\nEOE<br>\n<br>\nDrug Free Workplace</p></span>\n                                            </div>\n                                        "}

The Director is responsible for a hospital-wide quality management program and works with hospital administration, departments, and the medical staff to monitor and evaluate the quality of delivery of patient care services within the hospital. The Director also ensures proper compliance with regulatory agencies, accrediting bodies, corporate and hospital policies and procedures and works to develop, implement, and maintain quality assurance and improvement programs within the facility.</p>\n<p><strong>Job Type: </strong>Full-time</p>\n<p><strong>Hours: </strong>M - F, 8am - 5pm, including rotating Administrator on Call</p></span> \n                                                <div id=\"jobDescriptionTextFade\"></div>\n                                            \n\t\t</div>\n                                        \n                                            <h2>Job Requirements</h2>\n                                            <div class=\"section-body\">\n                                                <span id=\"CBBody_Requirements\" itemprop=\"qualifications\"><p><strong>License or Certification:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n    <li>None. We are a fast-paced outpatient medication assisted treatment facility.<br>\n<br>\n</p>\n<p>The successful candidate must possess strong therapeutic and supervisory skills. In this leadership role, the Clinical Supervisor will report to the Clinic Director.&nbsp; This position requires a thorough understanding of outpatient Treatment, the clinic's philosophy of treatment, the admission process, and admission criteria. The individual is responsible for insuring clinical and administrative services are provided for patients and their families. Must be able to work with minimum supervision. This is a working supervisor's position requiring the individual to serve as a working role model for other counselors. <br>\n<br>\n</p>\n<p>Tasks and Responsibility: </p>\n<p>1) Supervise a team of Counselors to assure timely completion of work and adherence to program policies and procedures;</p>\n<p>2) Provide weekly clinical supervision through documentation of assessment of professional competencies, clinical skills, and recommendations through weekly meetings and direct and periodic observation;</p>\n<p>3) Maintain a reduced caseload;</p>\n<p>4) Provide new hire orientation for Counselors;</p>\n<p>5) Prepare an annual training plan for Counselors;</p>\n<p>6) Comply with State/Federal and/or Certification/Licensure training requirements.</p></span> \n                                                <div id=\"jobDescriptionTextFade\"></div>\n                                            \n\t\t</div>\n                                        \n                                            <h2>Job Requirements</h2>\n                                            <div class=\"section-body\">\n                                                <span id=\"CBBody_Requirements\" itemprop=\"qualifications\"><p>Clinical Supervisor must have the following qualifications:<br>\n<br>\n</p>\n<p>1) Bachelor's degree from an accredited college / university with major emphasis in any of the following areas: social work, addiction studies, psychology, sociology, counseling, nursing or a related behavioral health field required. Master's degree preferred.</p>\n<p>2) Minimum two years supervised clinical experience in a health or human service agency; one year of which must be directly related to substance abuse treatment. </p>\n<p>3) ACCBO CADC II or equivalent</p>\n<p>4) Experience in mental health or in an addiction treatment setting preferred</p>\n<p>5) Strong verbal and written communication skills</p>\n<br></span>\n                                            </div>\n                                        "}

(i.e. Fire drills).</p>\n<p><span>4)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Communicates all incoming admissions, visits, deliveries and family program to appropriate staff on shift.</p>\n<p><span>5)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Assists with storage and retrieval of patient belongings as defined by the facility’s procedural guidelines.</p>\n<p><span>6)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Visually inspect all vehicles and informs persons of contraband rules.</p>\n<p><span>7)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; It is a team composed of data scientists, engineers, and business analysts. The team influences strategy and tactics of Chegg&rsquo;s business and engineering roadmap; develops data science algorithms for purposes of analysis, matching, and discovery; and provides business level decision support models for purposes of forecasting, pricing, and supply chain management. This position is based in Santa Clara, CA, and the role will be responsible for any and all of the following: Lead a small team of Data scientists in Chegg&rsquo;s Learning Services business unit. Develop and define key product and business insights to help guide decision-makers and executives in the digital services business. Develop and mentor a team of data scientists and foster their professional development. Engage with leaders of engineering, and product, to drive the future strategy for the company &ndash; grounded in data science. Requirements: Master&rsquo;s degree in a quantitative field, PhD is a bonus. 5-7 years of demonstrated success in data science and analytics, 3-5 years of managing analyst/data science teams. Extensive analytical toolset including an advanced understanding of statistics (time series analysis, cluster analysis, multivariate analysis), discrete simulation, linear and nonlinear optimization. Experience working with big data platforms such as Hadoop, Aster or Elastic MapReduce a plus. Passionate about producing high-quality analytics deliverables and communicating results to a broad audience. Self-motivated; independent, organized and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple business units and product teams.</p>\r\n\t</body>\r\n</html>\r\n"}

We are an acute rehabilitation hospital setting. Typically our therapists can expect to spend an average of 2-4 weeks with our patients treating a wide clinical caseload such as: stroke, spinal cord injury, brain injury, various neurological disorders, rheumatoid arthritis, osteoarthritis, amputation, joint replacement, fractures, multiple trauma, cardiac conditions, and pulmonary conditions. 80% of our patients are discharged directly home. </div> <div>    </div> <div>  We use evidence-based practice guidelines to treat our patients.  We utilize our clinical outcomes to asses and improve our treatment interventions and programs. We participate in a national outcomes database, which provides benchmarks and sophisticated outcome reports to help us continually analyze and improve our patient outcomes. </div> <div>    </div> <div>  Helping you become a better therapist is critical to our success </div> <div>    </div> <div>  - You will be paired with mentors; attend in-house as well as external educational programs. Primary focus is on the development and implementation of an effective asset renewal program for City owned facilities and other structures to meet legislative requirements, maximize service life, and Guided by strong project management principles and a commitment to excellence, the Branch builds and sustains outstanding facilities and landscapes that are transforming Edmonton. </font> </div><font face=\"Arial\" size=\"2\"><br></font> <div dir=\"ltr\"> <font face=\"Arial\" size=\"2\">Reporting to the General Supervisor, Asset Management, and utilizing the results of the Infrastructure Assessment activities, the Program Manager of Capital Renewal Planning will lead a team responsible for planning of renewal activities associated with city owned facility and landscape infrastructure (i.e. buildings including recreation centers, libraries, fire and police stations, transit centers? park, spray decks, splash pads, River Valley foot bridges etc.) with a goal of maximizing their lifespan and minimizing costs and disruption to public services. With the continued growth and aging of city buildings, there is an increase in the number of buildings and facilities that require renewal activities. Primary focus is on the development and implementation of an effective asset renewal program for City owned facilities and other structures to meet legislative requirements, maximize service life, and ensure reliable operation.</font> </div><font face=\"Arial\" size=\"2\"><br></font> <div dir=\"ltr\"> <font face=\"Arial\" size=\"2\">Additional position accountabilities include development of accurate rehabilitation project scope definition, schedule and estimates, completed in collaboration with other internal and external facility stakeholders.</font> </div><font face=\"Arial\" size=\"2\"><br></font> <div dir=\"ltr\"> <font face=\"Arial\" size=\"2\">Key accountabilities include:</font> </div> <ul> <li dir=\"ltr\"> <div dir=\"ltr\"> <font face=\"Arial\" size=\"2\">Ensure all facility and landscape renewal programs are coordinated and programmed efficiently and effectively, while collaborating with other sections within the FLI Branch, and all other facility and park stakeholders</font> </div></li> <li dir=\"ltr\"> <div dir=\"ltr\"> <font face=\"Arial\" size=\"2\">Work with other corporate stakeholders (internal and external to the Branch) to set renewal priorities, including updates to the Risk Based Infrastructure Management System (RIMS) to quantify deferred renewal</font> </div></li> <li dir=\"ltr\"> <div dir=\"ltr\"> <font face=\"Arial\" size=\"2\">Assist in the development of scope, schedule and budget for each facility and park infrastructure (spray parks, skate parks, retaining walls, gazebos, etc….) renewal process</font> </div></li> <li dir=\"ltr\"> <div dir=\"ltr\"> <font face=\"Arial\" size=\"2\">Develop the renewal priorities in all renewal composites managed by the Branch (i.e.building &amp; facility rehabilitation, parks conservation, etc…)</font> </div></li> <li dir=\"ltr\"> <div dir=\"ltr\"> <font face=\"Arial\" size=\"2\">Review and validate the programs with delivery areas to confirm resourcing and commitments</font> </div></li> <li dir=\"ltr\"> <div dir=\"ltr\"> <font face=\"Arial\" size=\"2\">Monitor the implementation (scope, schedule, budget and funding sources) of the current capital renewal program</font> </div></li> <li dir=\"ltr\"> <div dir=\"ltr\"> <font face=\"Arial\" size=\"2\">Provides direction and participates in the annual operational budgeting processes</font> </div></li> <li dir=\"ltr\"> <div dir=\"ltr\"> <font face=\"Arial\" size=\"2\">Planning and budgeting for short and long term manpower requirements in consultation with other general supervisors within the section. {"actual":"","id":"56a97a69e4b0f342eeed84f0","key":"Association Management, Business Development, Sales"}
{"actual":"","id":"56a97a69e4b0f342eeed84f0","key":"<table cellpadding=\"3\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" width=\"100%\" class=\"JobDetailTable\">\n\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t<tbody><tr>\n\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t<td colspan=\"1\" valign=\"top\"><b>\tJob Description: </b>\t\t\t\t\t\t<p><strong>Job Title: Account Manager</strong></p><p> </p><p>Sales professionals use systems, applications, processes and other resources to maximize revenue and growth for our client organizations. This role contributes to the development of prospect databases; sales collateral (including but not limited to prospectuses); sales report updates; exhibit sales; sponsorships; and a la carte offerings. Sales Professionals attend client organization events to pre-sell future events, as well as other projects as needed to support the sales efforts of the entire team for multiple client organizations. Sales Professionals must be extremely productive, demonstrate the ability to prioritize, be proficient building relationships over the phone and via e-mail, and work well in a team environment.</p><p> </p><p><strong>Primary Duties &amp; Responsibilities:</strong></p><ul><li>Database development, including but not limited to identification of target companies and influencers/decision makers; cold calling; qualifying prospects; and researching complimentary business markets to add to the contact database</li><li>Consistently closing sales prospects</li><li>Preparing activity and forecast reports for tracking sales progress against goals</li><li>Working in a team environment to ensure that the sales collateral represents the offerings to be sold</li><li>Building relationships with targeted companies/organizations through use of phone calls and e-mails</li><li>Attending client or competing events, as needed, to pre-sell for future events and/or build business relationships</li><li>Working on simultaneous goals/priorities effectively and efficiently</li><li>Working on multiple client deliverables effectively and efficiently</li><li>Developing and maintaining good working business relationships within a multi-client environment</li><li>Researching and learning industry-specific terminology and expertise</li></ul> \n\t\t\t\t\t</td>\n\t\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t</tr>\n\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t<tr>\n\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t<td colspan=\"1\" valign=\"top\"><b>\tQualifications: </b>\t\t\t\t\t\t<p> </p><p><strong>Knowledge, Skills, &amp; Abilities:</strong></p><ul><li>Must have successful experience prospecting customers and developing leads to include probing skills to identify key decision makers</li><li>Trade show exhibit booth, advertising, and/or sponsorship sales preferred</li></ul><p> </p><p><strong>Education &amp; </span>All other duties as assigned.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p><b></b></p>\n<p><b></b></p>\n<p><b></b></p>\n<p><b>OTHER FUNCTIONS</b>:</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p><span>1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>May be required to assist in the transportation of clients as needed on an emergency basis.</p>\n<p><span>2)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>May be required to work overtime in cases of inclement weather, call offs and/or other emergency situations.</p></span> \n                                                <div id=\"jobDescriptionTextFade\"></div>\n                                            \n\t\t</div>\n                                        \n                                            <h2>Job Requirements</h2>\n                                            <div class=\"section-body\">\n                                                <span id=\"CBBody_Requirements\" itemprop=\"qualifications\"><p><strong>JOB QUALIFICATIONS:<br>\n<br>\nExperience:</strong>&nbsp;&nbsp; <br>\nSecurity operations experience preferred.<br>\n<br>\n<strong>Education:</strong>&nbsp; <br>\nHigh school diploma or GED required.<br>\n<br>\n<strong>Licensure:</strong>&nbsp; <br>\nValid U.S. driver's license required.<br>\nAcceptable driving record required.<br>\nMust be at least 21 years of age.<br>\n<br>\n<strong>Other requirements:<br>\n</strong></p>\n<p><span>Needs physical mobility in order to monitor visitor activity.</span></p>\n<p><span>Good verbal and written communications skills.</span></p>\n<p>Must be able to successfully communicate with patients and all visitors, with respect and in a professional manner.</p>\n<p>Willingness to be flexible in adjusting to new and changing situations.</p>\n<p><br>\nEOE<br>\n<br>\nDrug Free Workplace</p></span>\n                                            </div>\n                                        "}

Dartmouth is approximately 60 miles south of Boston and 30 miles east of Providence and is the fifth largest town in the Commonwealth.</p><p><strong><br>Position Summary:</strong><br>This position will implement&nbsp;and facilitate the Performance Improvement and Risk management programs. Direct hospital compliance with laws, regulations and standards of the accrediting and approval agencies, including state licensure, CMS and the Joint Commission. Coordinate compliance activities with the Acadia Compliance Officer and oversee implementation of policy and procedure implementation.&nbsp;<br><br> </p><p><strong>Key Responsibilities Include:</strong> </p><ul>    <li>Provide the CEO with timely and accurate information related to Risk Management, regulatory Compliance, Performance Improvement and Compliance issues.&nbsp;</li>    <li>Advise and assist Management on Risk Management, regulatory Compliance, Performance Improvement, and Compliance issues.</li>    <li>Provide management and staff education as needs identified.</li>    <li>Serve as a member of the Management Team and on facility committees as requested.</li>    <li>Interpret and implement corporate and facility policies and procedures in accordance with law and regulatory/accreditation requirements.</li></ul><ul>    <li>Serve as Administrator on Call as assigned.</li>    <li>Define required clinical data sets in conjunction with the Medical Staff, clinical leaders and Acadia Corporate clinical and risk resources.</li>    <li>Implement the Performance Improvement Program.</li>    <li>Set expectations, develop plans and manage processes to measure, assess, and improve the quality of the organization’s management, clinical and support activities.</li>    <li>Measure, analyze and manage variation in the performance of defined processes that affect patient safety.</li>    <li>Implement the Risk Management Program.</li>    <li>Identify opportunities to reduce risk exposure.</li>    <li>Lead the hospital’s compliance program in conjunction with Corporate Compliance Officer.</li>    <li>Coordinate agenda and reports for Medical Staff meetings.</li>    <li>Coordinate with Medical Director and CEO to ensure Medical Staff Bylaws, Rules &amp; Regulations, and Credentialing Plan are fully implemented.</li>    <li>Develop, administer and oversee systems for ongoing regulatory compliance.</li></ul><p><br></p><ul> </ul></span> \n                                                <div id=\"jobDescriptionTextFade\"></div>\n                                            \n\t\t</div>\n                                        \n                                            <h2>Job Requirements</h2>\n                                            <div class=\"section-body\">\n                                                <span id=\"CBBody_Requirements\" itemprop=\"qualifications\"><p><strong>Desired Skills and Experience</strong></p><ul>    <li>Bachelor’s Degree in a healthcare related field.</li>    <li>CPI per policy</li>    <li>5 year’s experience in healthcare with 2 years behavioral experience preferred.</li>    <li>Knowledge of laws and regulations of federal, state and local governmental agencies and with the standards, rules and regulations of accrediting agencies as applicable to the facility preferred.</li></ul></span>\n                                            </div>\n                                        "}

Dartmouth is approximately 60 miles south of Boston and 30 miles east of Providence and is the fifth largest town in the Commonwealth.</p><p> <strong>Position Summary:</strong></p><p>This position will plan and direct the Hospital Food Service staff to ensure safe, nutritious and cost effective meals and snacks for patients, clients, employees, and visitors, in accordance with Public Health standards.<br><br></p><p><br></p><p><strong>Position Description:</strong></p><ul>    <li>Plan the operating food service budget for the hospital and monitors monthly expenditures including the weekly inventory of food and supplies. </li>    <li>Evaluation of new food products for use in the facility are the responsibility of the incumbent.&nbsp;</li>    <li>Plan nutritionally balanced &amp; therapeutic meals in accordance with Public Health regulations and the production capacity of the hospital.&nbsp;</li>    <li>Work with staff in the development of food and nutrition goals and objectives which provide cost effective services that meet established guidelines of nutrition and sanitation. </li>    <li>Initiate policies and procedures which serve as standards and methods for the planning and evaluation of dietary responsibilities.&nbsp;</li>    <li>Manage the work of supervisory, skilled and unskilled staff responsible for preparation and serving of meals and sanitation of work areas.</li>    <li>Prepare monthly departmental schedules and maintain adequate staffing.</li>    <li>Act as a liaison with patients, families and staff on nutrition and food service matters.&nbsp;</li></ul></span> \n                                                <div id=\"jobDescriptionTextFade\"></div>\n                                            \n\t\t</div>\n                                        \n                                            <h2>Job Requirements</h2>\n                                            <div class=\"section-body\">\n                                                <span id=\"CBBody_Requirements\" itemprop=\"qualifications\"><p><strong>Desired Skills and Experience</strong></p><ul>    <li>Graduation from an accredited college or university with a degree in a food service related field supplemented.</li>    <li>&nbsp;Three years’ experience in an institutional food service, preferably in a health care setting. </li>    <li>Registered Dietician Massachusetts Licensure.</li></ul></span>\n                                            </div>\n                                        "}

Works closely with CFO to achieve facility goals for AR days and Collections. </span><strong> </strong></p>\n<ul>\n    <li>Monitors and reports on key metrics such as cash collections, days outstanding, unbilled, denials, etc., in conjunction with the CFO.</li>\n    <li>Establishes and maintains controls for all cash collected and posted in Patient Accounting system.</li>\n    <li>Maintains effective communication with third party insurance carriers to resolve issues that impede cash flow and detract from patient/member satisfaction.</li>\n    <li>Maintains effective communication with the leadership team to ensure that all third party compliance guidelines are met.</li>\n    <li>Selects and monitors outside collection vendors engaged in the collection of Hospital receivables. Reviews and balances agency reports to hospital; system reports and approves agency invoices.</li>\n    <li>Leads and provides operational directives for all Business office activities related to the claims management and collections of Cascade receivables and ensures timely, efficient cash collections to support the overall financial goals of the facility.</li>\n    <li>Define and provide the necessary support and leadership to achieve departmental goals and objectives.</li>\n    <li>Reviews all statistical reports to monitor trends and determine operational deficiencies and implements corrective action plans as necessary.</li>\n</ul></span> \n                                                <div id=\"jobDescriptionTextFade\"></div>\n                                            \n\t\t</div>\n                                        \n                                            <h2>Job Requirements</h2>\n                                            <div class=\"section-body\">\n                                                <span id=\"CBBody_Requirements\" itemprop=\"qualifications\"><p><strong><span>Desired Skills and Experience<br>\n<br>\n</span></strong></p>\n<ul>\n    <li>Must have at least 3 years experience as a hospital business office director or supervisor .</li>\n    <li>Behavioral health &amp; HMS experience preferred.</li>\n    <li>Inpatient experience required.</li>\n    <li>Business Degree preferred.</li>\n    <li>Excellent written and verbal communications skills. </li>\n    <li>Ability to work with all levels of staff and management.</li>\n</ul></span>\n                                            </div>\n                                        "}

</p>\n<p style=\"text-align: justify\">Consistently demonstrates the hospital’s mission, vision, and values by exhibiting excellence and competence, collaboration, innovation, respect for personalization, commitment to our community, and accountability and ownership.</p>\n<p><strong>Position Responsibilities:</strong></p>\n<p><br></p>\n<ul>\n    <li>Facilitate all incoming inquiries of prospective clients, loved ones and mental health/medical professionals with a sense of urgency and compassion.</li>\n    <li>Exhibit a high level of professionalism and excellent customer service skills with each call, tour and admission.</li>\n    <li>Obtain clinical information and other medical information (as applicable) to determine appropriateness for the hospital.</li>\n    <li>Assist callers in identifying the benefits of the hospital’s program as relevant to their individual situation.</li>\n    <li>Utilize an Intervention style approach (when applicable) to assist callers in working through ambivalence.</li>\n    <li>Demonstrate exceptional follow-up skills with families and treating professionals.</li>\n    <li>Prepare and facilitate all aspects of the admissions process, including all intake paperwork.</li>\n    <li>Conduct campus-wide tours.</li>\n    <li>Maintains Salesforce database by entering incoming and outgoing calls.</li>\n    <li>Make outbound phone calls to referents, as assigned.</li>\n</ul>\n<br>\n<p><br></p></span> \n                                                <div id=\"jobDescriptionTextFade\"></div>\n                                            \n\t\t</div>\n                                        \n                                            <h2>Job Requirements</h2>\n                                            <div class=\"section-body\">\n                                                <span id=\"CBBody_Requirements\" itemprop=\"qualifications\"><p><strong>Job Requirements</strong></p>\n<p style=\"text-align: justify\"><span>­&nbsp; Dartmouth is approximately 60 miles south of Boston and 30 miles east of Providence and is the fifth largest town in the Commonwealth.<br>\n<br>\n</p>\n<p style=\"text-align: justify\"><strong>Position Summary:</strong></p>\n<p style=\"text-align: justify\">The Admissions Director is responsible for answering all inquiry calls and assessing the appropriateness of the resident’s physical health condition to facilitate an acceptable admission.&nbsp; </p>\n<p style=\"text-align: justify\">Consistently demonstrates the hospital’s mission, vision, and values by exhibiting excellence and competence, collaboration, innovation, respect for personalization, commitment to our community, and accountability and ownership.</p>\n<p><strong>Position Responsibilities:</strong></p>\n<p><br></p>\n<ul>\n    <li>Facilitate all incoming inquiries of prospective clients, loved ones and mental health/medical professionals with a sense of urgency and compassion.</li>\n    <li>Exhibit a high level of professionalism and excellent customer service skills with each call, tour and admission.</li>\n    <li>Obtain clinical information and other medical information (as applicable) to determine appropriateness for the hospital.</li>\n    <li>Assist callers in identifying the benefits of the hospital’s program as relevant to their individual situation.</li>\n    <li>Utilize an Intervention style approach (when applicable) to assist callers in working through ambivalence.</li>\n    <li>Demonstrate exceptional follow-up skills with families and treating professionals.</li>\n    <li>Prepare and facilitate all aspects of the admissions process, including all intake paperwork.</li>\n    <li>Conduct campus-wide tours.</li>\n    <li>Maintains Salesforce database by entering incoming and outgoing calls.</li>\n    <li>Make outbound phone calls to referents, as assigned.</li>\n</ul>\n<br>\n<p><br></p></span> \n                                                <div id=\"jobDescriptionTextFade\"></div>\n                                            \n\t\t</div>\n                                        \n                                            <h2>Job Requirements</h2>\n                                            <div class=\"section-body\">\n                                                <span id=\"CBBody_Requirements\" itemprop=\"qualifications\"><p><strong>Job Requirements</strong></p>\n<p style=\"text-align: justify\"><span>­&nbsp; They document, report and communicates results obtained to executive leadership. The Director of nursing is personally accountable for keeping abreast of knowledge of compliance regulations, and health care trends as applicable to Behavioral Health.<br>\n<br>\n</span><strong> </strong></p>\n<p><strong>Job Responsibilities:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n    <li>Responsible for the provision of quality nursing services 24 hours a day, seven (7) days a week.</li>\n    <li>Insures clear, concise and current written policies and procedures are available to assist the staff and minimize risk factors.</li>\n    <li>Recommends modifications, additions or deletions to nursing staffing plans to ensure reasonable hours and acceptable working conditions to provide optimal patient care coverage.</li>\n    <li>Initiates and participates in problem solving, policy forming conferences for patient care services.&nbsp; </li>\n    <li>Participates in the Executive, Finance, Governing Body, medical staff, and Management&nbsp; meetings.</li>\n    <li>Plans and coordinates with the Chief Executive Officer, utilizing the respective service managers for planning the budgeting requirements for staff, performance of work, supplies and equipment.</li>\n    <li>As department head, provides hands on leadership and management and demonstrates a commitment to educating, growing and mentoring staff.</li>\n    <li>The results of each department's performance improvement activities are reported to the respective medical staff committees and to the hospital wide performance improvement committee.</li>\n    <li>Is responsible for insuring regulatory compliance and insures patients receive the highest level&nbsp; of quality services.</li>\n</ul>\n</span><p></p> \n                                                <div id=\"jobDescriptionTextFade\"></div>\n                                            \n\t\t</div>\n                                        \n                                            <h2>Job Requirements</h2>\n                                            <div class=\"section-body\">\n                                                <span id=\"CBBody_Requirements\" itemprop=\"qualifications\"><div><br></div>\n<ul>\n    <li>MSN preferred, BSN required.</li>\n    <li>TN Nursing Licensure. </li>\n    <li>5-10 years Psych. Dartmouth is approximately 60 miles south of Boston and 30 miles east of Providence and is the fifth largest town in the Commonwealth.</p><p> <strong>Position Summary:</strong></p><p>This position will plan and direct the Hospital Food Service staff to ensure safe, nutritious and cost effective meals and snacks for patients, clients, employees, and visitors, in accordance with Public Health standards.<br><br></p><p><br></p><p><strong>Position Description:</strong></p><ul>    <li>Plan the operating food service budget for the hospital and monitors monthly expenditures including the weekly inventory of food and supplies. </li>    <li>Evaluation of new food products for use in the facility are the responsibility of the incumbent.&nbsp;</li>    <li>Plan nutritionally balanced &amp; therapeutic meals in accordance with Public Health regulations and the production capacity of the hospital.&nbsp;</li>    <li>Work with staff in the development of food and nutrition goals and objectives which provide cost effective services that meet established guidelines of nutrition and sanitation. </li>    <li>Initiate policies and procedures which serve as standards and methods for the planning and evaluation of dietary responsibilities.&nbsp;</li>    <li>Manage the work of supervisory, skilled and unskilled staff responsible for preparation and serving of meals and sanitation of work areas.</li>    <li>Prepare monthly departmental schedules and maintain adequate staffing.</li>    <li>Act as a liaison with patients, families and staff on nutrition and food service matters.&nbsp;</li></ul></span> \n                                                <div id=\"jobDescriptionTextFade\"></div>\n                                            \n\t\t</div>\n                                        \n                                            <h2>Job Requirements</h2>\n                                            <div class=\"section-body\">\n                                                <span id=\"CBBody_Requirements\" itemprop=\"qualifications\"><p><strong>Desired Skills and Experience</strong></p><ul>    <li>Graduation from an accredited college or university with a degree in a food service related field supplemented.</li>    <li>&nbsp;Three years’ experience in an institutional food service, preferably in a health care setting. </li>    <li>Registered Dietician Massachusetts Licensure.</li></ul></span>\n                                            </div>\n                                        "}

Nestled in the hills surrounding the major commerce corridors are quiet residential neighborhoods.<br>\n<br>\n<strong><span>Cascade Behavioral Hospital</span></strong> offers an innovative program combining the best of inpatient and outpatient care for adults. Our seamless continuum of care provides medically-based treatment throughout every stage of recovery — from acute medical detoxification to therapeutic outpatient counseling.</span></p>\n<p><strong><span>Position Summary</span></strong></p>\n<p><span>The Business Office Director will report to the CFO and be responsible for managing all aspects of billing and collecting patient accounts. This position provides direction to business office staff including Financial Counseling, Billing, Collections and Data Entry. Works closely with CFO to achieve facility goals for AR days and Collections. </span><strong> </strong></p>\n<ul>\n    <li>Monitors and reports on key metrics such as cash collections, days outstanding, unbilled, denials, etc., in conjunction with the CFO.</li>\n    <li>Establishes and maintains controls for all cash collected and posted in Patient Accounting system.</li>\n    <li>Maintains effective communication with third party insurance carriers to resolve issues that impede cash flow and detract from patient/member satisfaction.</li>\n    <li>Maintains effective communication with the leadership team to ensure that all third party compliance guidelines are met.</li>\n    <li>Selects and monitors outside collection vendors engaged in the collection of Hospital receivables. Reviews and balances agency reports to hospital; system reports and approves agency invoices.</li>\n    <li>Leads and provides operational directives for all Business office activities related to the claims management and collections of Cascade receivables and ensures timely, efficient cash collections to support the overall financial goals of the facility.</li>\n    <li>Define and provide the necessary support and leadership to achieve departmental goals and objectives.</li>\n    <li>Reviews all statistical reports to monitor trends and determine operational deficiencies and implements corrective action plans as necessary.</li>\n</ul></span> \n                                                <div id=\"jobDescriptionTextFade\"></div>\n                                            \n\t\t</div>\n                                        \n                                            <h2>Job Requirements</h2>\n                                            <div class=\"section-body\">\n                                                <span id=\"CBBody_Requirements\" itemprop=\"qualifications\"><p><strong><span>Desired Skills and Experience<br>\n<br>\n</span></strong></p>\n<ul>\n    <li>Must have at least 3 years experience as a hospital business office director or supervisor .</li>\n    <li>Behavioral health &amp; HMS experience preferred.</li>\n    <li>Inpatient experience required.</li>\n    <li>Business Degree preferred.</li>\n    <li>Excellent written and verbal communications skills. </li>\n    <li>Ability to work with all levels of staff and management.</li>\n</ul></span>\n                                            </div>\n                                        "}

The Clinic Director is the final administrative and clinic authority with regard to the day-to-day operations of the clinic. In collaboration with the Medical Director (when addressing issues impacting medical treatment), the Clinic Director oversees and supervises all staff activity and decision-making.</span></p>\n<p style=\"text-align: justify\"><strong><span>&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\n<p style=\"text-align: justify\"><strong><span>Additional Position Responsibilities:</span></strong> </p>\n<ul>\n    <li>Develops implements, supervises and evaluated all therapeutic components of the program for assigned patient populations, and the facility.</li>\n    <li>Ensure that all State and Federal Regulations, including CARF accreditation standards are maintained at all times, including the submission of corrective action plans to said agencies.</li>\n    <li>Achieve financial results to meet operations budget.</li>\n    <li>Generate reports to evaluate overall clinic performance.</li>\n    <li>Maintains compliance with national accreditation, governmental regulations and maintains the clinic’s operating licenses.</li>\n    <li>Responsible for overall clinical performance and quality outcomes management, including client satisfaction with clinic and clinic services.</li>\n    <li>Responsible for payer and referral source satisfaction with the clinic.</li>\n    <li>Development and implementation of all clinic policies and procedures including public affairs and community relations.</li>\n    <li>Integration of staff services as described in clinic protocol/operations manual.</li>\n    <li>Managing and monitoring productivity standards and providing training and supervision of all staff.</li>\n</ul>\n<p style=\"text-align: justify\"><span>&nbsp;</span></p>\n<p style=\"text-align: justify\"><span>&nbsp;</span></p>\n<br></span> \n                                                <div id=\"jobDescriptionTextFade\"></div>\n                                            \n\t\t</div>\n                                        \n {"actual":"","id":"556dd0f2e4b0afff2e7e0bcc","key":"\n                                            <h2>Job Description</h2>\n                                            <div id=\"pnlJobDescription\" class=\"section-body\" itemprop=\"description\">\n\t\t\t\n                                                <span id=\"CBBody_Description\"><p style=\"text-align: justify\">Rebound Behavioral Health is currently seeking a Full-time Health Information Management (HIM) Manager. Rebound Behavioral Health is a 42 bed adult, acute inpatient behavioral health hospital located in Lancaster, SC (20 miles South of Charlotte, NC). Rebound offers a high-quality, comprehensive benefit package to our employees including</p>\n<ul>\n    <li>Annual vacation time</li>\n    <li>Group health insurance</li>\n    <li>Participation in a 401(k) plan</li>\n    <li>Annual salary review </li>\n</ul>\n<p style=\"text-align: justify\">&nbsp;</p>\n<p><span style=\"text-decoration: underline\"><strong>Health Information Management (HIM) Manager</strong></span> </p>\n<p>The HIM Manager plans, organizes and oversees the day-to-day operations of the Health Information Management (HIM) department, including coding and release of information and maintains the privacy, safety and security of records. Ensures that all outpatient and inpatient records are processed for timely and accurate chart completion and ensures documentation guidelines and rules for correct coding are met. Coordinates HIM functions with clinical operations departments. Works closely with Medical Staff in matters of chart completion and documentation to ensure proper coding accuracy, optimal reimbursement and compliance with licensing, accreditation and legal requirements and to enhance the physician-hospital relationship. Serves as the hospital's Compliance and HIPAA Privacy officer.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Standard Hours: 40.0/week</p>\n<p>Schedule: Monday - Friday, occassional weekends may be required as needed.</p></span> \n                                                <div id=\"jobDescriptionTextFade\"></div>\n                                            \n\t\t</div>\n                                        \n                                            <h2>Job Requirements</h2>\n                                            <div class=\"section-body\">\n                                                <span id=\"CBBody_Requirements\" itemprop=\"qualifications\"><p><strong>Required Education and Experience:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n    <li>Associate's degree required; Bachelor's degree preferred;</li>\n    <li>3 - 5 years of progressive HIM and coding experience;</li>\n    <li>Strong knowledge and training in ICD-10-CM;</li>\n    <li>Supervisory experience preferred.</li>\n</ul>\n<p><strong>Required Licenses, Certifications and/or Registrations:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n    <li>Redistered Health Information Technician (RHIT) Certification, required;</li>\n    <li>Certified Professional Coder (CPC or similar), required;</li>\n    <li>Registered Health Information Adminstrator (RHIA) Certification, preferred.</li>\n</ul></span>\n                                            </div>\n                                        "}
