{"actual":"","id":"556dd0f2e4b0afff2e7e0bd3","key":"\n                                            <h2>Job Description</h2>\n                                            <div id=\"pnlJobDescription\" class=\"section-body\" itemprop=\"description\">\n\t\t\t\n                                                <span id=\"CBBody_Description\"><p style=\"text-align: justify\">Rebound Behavioral Health is currently seeking a Full-time Health Information Management (HIM) Manager. Rebound Behavioral Health is a 42 bed adult, acute inpatient behavioral health hospital located in Lancaster, SC (20 miles South of Charlotte, NC). Rebound offers a high-quality, comprehensive benefit package to our employees including</p>\n<ul>\n    <li>Annual vacation time</li>\n    <li>Group health insurance</li>\n    <li>Participation in a 401(k) plan</li>\n    <li>Annual salary review </li>\n</ul>\n<p style=\"text-align: justify\">&nbsp;</p>\n<p><span style=\"text-decoration: underline\"><strong>Health Information Management (HIM) Manager</strong></span> </p>\n<p>The HIM Manager plans, organizes and oversees the day-to-day operations of the Health Information Management (HIM) department, including coding and release of information and maintains the privacy, safety and security of records. Ensures that all outpatient and inpatient records are processed for timely and accurate chart completion and ensures documentation guidelines and rules for correct coding are met. Coordinates HIM functions with clinical operations departments. Works closely with Medical Staff in matters of chart completion and documentation to ensure proper coding accuracy, optimal reimbursement and compliance with licensing, accreditation and legal requirements and to enhance the physician-hospital relationship. Serves as the hospital's Compliance and HIPAA Privacy officer.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Standard Hours: 40.0/week</p>\n<p>Schedule: Monday - Friday, occassional weekends may be required as needed.</p></span> \n                                                <div id=\"jobDescriptionTextFade\"></div>\n                                            \n\t\t</div>\n                                        \n                                            <h2>Job Requirements</h2>\n                                            <div class=\"section-body\">\n                                                <span id=\"CBBody_Requirements\" itemprop=\"qualifications\"><p><strong>Required Education and Experience:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n    <li>Associate's degree required; Bachelor's degree preferred;</li>\n    <li>3 - 5 years of progressive HIM and coding experience;</li>\n    <li>Strong knowledge and training in ICD-10-CM;</li>\n    <li>Supervisory experience preferred.</li>\n</ul>\n<p><strong>Required Licenses, Certifications and/or Registrations:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n    <li>Redistered Health Information Technician (RHIT) Certification, required;</li>\n    <li>Certified Professional Coder (CPC or similar), required;</li>\n    <li>Registered Health Information Adminstrator (RHIA) Certification, preferred.</li>\n</ul></span>\n                                            </div>\n                                        "}

{"actual":"","id":"551920a4e4b062c582e5afd0","key":"Technology Support"}
{"actual":"","id":"551920a4e4b062c582e5afd0","key":"<p><strong>Your success is a train ride away.</strong><br /><br /><span style=\"line-height: 1.6em; font-size: 13px;\">Amtrak connects businesses and communities across the country and we move America’s workforce toward the future. We employ more than 20,000 diverse, energetic professionals in a variety of career fields throughout the United States. The safety of our passengers, our employees, the public and our operating environment is our priority and the success of our railroad is the result of our employees.</span><br /><br /><strong>Are you ready to join our team?</strong></p><p><strong>Location TBD: Atlanta, Philadelphia, Washington, Wilmington</strong></p><p> </p><p><strong>SUMMARY OF DUTIES</strong>:<br />The Principal Technologist is an expert/lead technical role.  Works on one or more projects of high complexity as the technology subject matter expert and/or technical leader/consultant. When involved with a project team, acts in a consultative manner and typically does not provide administrative or management type of support. Works on the most complex tasks and projects, or supports issues that involve the highest degree of risk, impacts enterprise-wide performance and makes use of the individual's high level of knowledge within one or more areas of specialty.</p><p> </p><p><strong>ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:</strong><br />• Researches and analyzes advanced technology trends within area of erpertise. Identifies emerging trends and initiates research projects for team members.<br />• Coordinates the assessment of emerging technologies.  Evaluates and may recommend new products or tools for the organization.  Oversees cost-benefit and risk analysis and presents options to Sr. Management teams.<br />• Partners with leadership to define and communicate long-term technology strategy and planning for the enterprise.<br />• Assists and/or may lead in the development and analysis of source selection strategies.<br />• Works with service providers to ensure that their in-scope technical solutions are consistent with the enterprise business strategy and architecture.<br />• Serves as a consultant, trusted advisor and, as necessary, escalation point (Tier 3) for issues.  Provides project managers with technical consultation and advice, enabling quick response to inquiries related to the program/project.<br />• Provides technical analyses to help define, assess and monitor the technical aspects of the program/project or services.<br />• Designs inovative solutions using new technologies.  Recommends short-term alternatives when appropriate.  Reviews proposed designs at key milestones and approves additional efforts.<br />• Troubleshoots existing information systems or networks to identify errors or deficiencies.  Brainstorms possible solutions and evaluates alternatives against decision criteria.<br />• Coordinates the resolution of support issues escalated by senior operations, development personnel or service provider personnel.  Guides vendors during the problem resolution process as needed.<br />• Provides technical expertise across business functions. Identifies opportunities to improve business processes via new technologies.<br />• Represents Amtrak in relevant industry forums.<br />• Position may manage technical personnel/contractors or vendors.<br />• Responsible for development, documentation, maintenance and creating Identity & Access Management (IAM) technical delivery of OpenIDM components.<br />• Responsible for ensuring appropriate collection of technical functional requirements based on critical client IAM use cases and expectations.  This would include analyzing requirements, estimating work effort, proof of concept, etc…<br />• Conducts in depth technical IAM research, needs assessments and performance analysis to support, design, and develop new technical IAM components.<br />• Responsible for upgrades and maintenance of the existing Identity Management system.  This would also include enhancements and bug fixes.  (Forge Rock OpenIDM)</p><p> </p><p><strong>WORK EXPERIENCE:</strong></p><p>• Bachelor's degree in engineering or computer science, or equivalent work experience.<br />•Extensive experience in relevant technical experience preferably in a leadership or a Subject Matter Expert capacity.<br />•Relevant Architecture/Engineering Certifications.<br />• ITIL, or equivalent Certification<br />• Must possess strong communication and interpersonal skills, work well with others in an integrated team environment, and must be self-motivated<br />•Must posess working experience utilizing the ITIL Framwork for Incident, Change, Problem and Release Management.<br />•Demonstrated experience with Object Oriented programming in Java with 3+ years of Tomcat or other application servers.<br />• Experience with XML technologies, JAVA Script, REST, HTML, JSON, MS SQL, Groovy, JQuery, Angular JS, SAML, Web Development and WS Federations<br />• Demonstrated experience with Forge Rock OpenIDM and/or Sun Identity Manager.<br />• Demonstrated experience in integrating security and IAM products with common identity stores / resources such as:  (SAP, LDAP, relational databases, application servers, virtual directory servers, and physical access management systems.)<br />• Strong data analysis skills and ability to solve complex problems independently and to generate innovative solutions.</p><p><br />Must have expert knowledge of:<br />• Experience with Identity and Access Management (IAM) systems such as OpenIDM, Sun Identity Manager, Oracle Identity Manager, CA Identity Manager, Tivoli, etc…<br />• Software development experience with particular concentration in large, highly distributed systems.<br />• Must have a strong understanding of UNIX/Linux and the Windows server environments.<br />• Knowledge of SSL certificates.  Renewals, creation and deployment. <br />• Experience with monitoring and performance tuning.</p><p> </p><p><strong>PREFERRED:</strong><br />• Masters degree in engineering or computer science, or equivalent.<br />• Certifications related to Identity and Access Management<br />• AWS Experience<br />• Experience converting from Sun products to Forge Rock products. <br />• Experience deploying internet facing systems. <br />• Experience with BYOD</p><p><br /><strong>COMMUNICATION AND INTERPERSONAL SKILLS:</strong> Must have excellent oral and written communication skills.</p><p> </p><p><strong>SUPERVISORY He/She will also perform data manipulation and in-depth analysis of complex health care data using programming languages such as SAS and SQL to produce analysis on costs, utilization, and outcomes.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color:black\">The ideal candidate will have superior SAS and SQL Programming skills as well as analytic skills. He/she must be adept at conducting data manipulation and performing in-depth analysis of complex health care administrative data. The SAS Macro Programmer/Analyst will have an opportunity to inform business decisions through analysis, so the ideal candidate will have an interest and understanding of client programs, in addition to being an exemplary SAS or SQL programmer. We are looking for individuals with advance data manipulation/programming and analytic skills who show a passion and interest in health care/health care policy. </span><br />\n<br />\n<strong><span Represent engineering in Failure Review Boards and Change Control Boards. Maintain and implement design changes in the Technical Data Package and requirements/specifications. Review designs periodically for obsolescence issues, perform trade studies, and recommend/implement changes as required. Must be able to work in a high visibility, fast paced team environment, requiring minimal direction.<br />\n<br />\n<strong>Required Skills: </strong></span></span>\n\n<ul>\n\t<li><span style=\"font-size:14px\"><span style=\"font-family:times new roman,times,serif\">Minimum of 2 years manufacturing and/or test related experience in a demanding production environment. </span></span></li>\n\t<li><span style=\"font-size:14px\"><span style=\"font-family:times new roman,times,serif\">Thorough understanding of manufacturing processes </span></span></li>\n\t<li><span {"actual":"","id":"568be8f6e4b010257b9cecf0","key":"<div><div> Description</div><div> <div>  This is a per diem, level I position. The per diem minimum work commitment is 12-hours per month with 8 of those being on the weekend. The per diem level I rate is $47.50p/h. There is also a $3p/h weekend shift differential. </div> <div>    </div> <div>  The Speech-Language Pathologist provides speech-language therapy treatment and patient care according to hospital, state, professional and federal regulations and guidelines.  In addition, the position: </div> <div>    </div> <div>  - Requires effective communication skills for working with patients, families,  and caregivers. </div> <div>    </div> <div>  - Requires effective communication skills for departmental and interdepartmental relationships. </div> <div>    </div> <div>  - Requires competency in speech-language pathology evaluation, assessment, care planning and treatment. </div> <div>    </div> <div>  - Requires task delegation and supervision of fellows, technicians and assistants (when applicable). </div> <div>    </div> <div>  - Maintains open and on-going communication with hospital departments to ensure patient, staff, and hospital needs are met. </div> <div>    </div> <div>  The Speech-Language Pathologist creates an environment and culture that enables the hospital to fulfill its mission by providing patient safety and patient-centered treatment. </div> <div>    </div> <div>  <strong>Benefits:</strong> </div> <div>  <strong></strong>  </div> <div>  To attract and retain the best professionals, we offer a comprehensive and competitive Benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, 401(k), college savings plan, employee assistance program, pre-paid legal plan and much more.  For more information on available Benefits, please click here. </div> <div>    </div> <div>  Who will you treat? We are an acute rehabilitation hospital setting. Typically our therapists can expect to spend an average of 2-4 weeks with our patients treating a wide clinical caseload such as: stroke, spinal cord injury, brain injury, various neurological disorders, rheumatoid arthritis, osteoarthritis, amputation, joint replacement, fractures, multiple trauma, cardiac conditions, and pulmonary conditions. 80% of our patients are discharged directly home. </div> <div>    </div> <div>  We use evidence-based practice guidelines to treat our patients.  We utilize our clinical outcomes to asses and improve our treatment interventions and programs. We participate in a national outcomes database, which provides benchmarks and sophisticated outcome reports to help us continually analyze and improve our patient outcomes. </div> <div>    </div> <div>  Helping you become a better therapist is critical to our success </div> <div>    </div> <div>  - You will be paired with mentors; attend in-house as well as external educational programs. The treatment team is made up of full time therapists, nurses, social workers, pharmacists and medical staff; a great way to learn beyond your own discipline. </div> <div>    </div> <div>  Job Code:100028 </div></div><p> </p></div><div><div> Qualifications</div><div> <div>  <div>   <div>    <strong>License or Certification:</strong>   </div>   <div>    <strong></strong>    </div>   <div>    - Active California SLP licensure is required.   </div>   <div>        </div>   <div>    - Active CPR certification is required (American Heart Association approved)   </div>   <div>        </div>   <div>    Education, Training and Experience   </div>   <div>        </div>   <div>    - Successful completion of a Master's degree or higher from an accredited therapy program or one that is determined to be substantially equivalent to a U.S. accredited program by an appropriate certifying agency preferred.   </div>   <div>        </div>   <div>    <strong>Physical Requirements:</strong>   </div>   <div>    <strong></strong>    </div>   <div>    - Good visual acuity and ability to communicate.   </div>   <div>        </div>   <div>    - Ability to lift a minimum of 30 pounds and ability push/pull a minimum of 30 pounds, which includes the lifting, pushing and/or pulling of medical supplies and equipment and the transferring and repositioning of patients.   </div>  </div> </div></div></div>"}

In addition, the position: </div> <div>    </div> <div>  - Requires effective communication skills for working with patients, families,  and caregivers. </div> <div>    </div> <div>  - Requires effective communication skills for departmental and interdepartmental relationships. </div> <div>    </div> <div>  - Requires competency in speech-language pathology evaluation, assessment, care planning and treatment. </div> <div>    </div> <div>  - Requires task delegation and supervision of fellows, technicians and assistants (when applicable). </div> <div>    </div> <div>  - Maintains open and on-going communication with hospital departments to ensure patient, staff, and hospital needs are met. </div> <div>    </div> <div>  The Speech-Language Pathologist creates an environment and culture that enables the hospital to fulfill its mission by providing patient safety and patient-centered treatment. </div> <div>    </div> <div>  <strong>Benefits:</strong> </div> <div>  <strong></strong>  </div> <div>  To attract and retain the best professionals, we offer a comprehensive and competitive Benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, 401(k), college savings plan, employee assistance program, pre-paid legal plan and much more.  For more information on available Benefits, please click here. </div> <div>    </div> <div>  Who will you treat? We are an acute rehabilitation hospital setting. Typically our therapists can expect to spend an average of 2-4 weeks with our patients treating a wide clinical caseload such as: stroke, spinal cord injury, brain injury, various neurological disorders, rheumatoid arthritis, osteoarthritis, amputation, joint replacement, fractures, multiple trauma, cardiac conditions, and pulmonary conditions. 80% of our patients are discharged directly home. </div> <div>    </div> <div>  We use evidence-based practice guidelines to treat our patients.  We utilize our clinical outcomes to asses and improve our treatment interventions and programs. We participate in a national outcomes database, which provides benchmarks and sophisticated outcome reports to help us continually analyze and improve our patient outcomes. </div> <div>    </div> <div>  Helping you become a better therapist is critical to our success </div> <div>    </div> <div>  - You will be paired with mentors; attend in-house as well as external educational programs. The treatment team is made up of full time therapists, nurses, social workers, pharmacists and medical staff; a great way to learn beyond your own discipline. </div> <div>    </div> <div>  Job Code:100028 </div></div><p> </p></div><div><div> Qualifications</div><div> <div>  <div>   <div>    <strong>License or Certification:</strong>   </div>   <div>    <strong></strong>    </div>   <div>    - Must be in possession of current state license or certification on or before the first day of employment.   </div>   <div>        </div>   <div>    - CPR certification preferred unless otherwise required by hospital policy.   </div>   <div>    Education, Training and Experience   </div>   <div>        </div>   <div>    - Successful completion of a Master's degree or higher from an accredited therapy program or one that is determined to be substantially equivalent to a U.S. accredited program by an appropriate certifying agency preferred.   </div>   <div>        </div>   <div>    <strong>Physical Requirements:</strong>   </div>   <div>    <strong></strong>    </div>   <div>    - Good visual acuity and ability to communicate.   </div>   <div>        </div>   <div>    - Ability to lift a minimum of 30 pounds and ability push/pull a minimum of 30 pounds, which includes the lifting, pushing and/or pulling of medical supplies and equipment and the transferring and repositioning of patients.   </div>  </div> </div></div></div>"}

Thousands of organizations around the world rely on Informatica for maximizing return on data to drive their top business imperatives and fully leverage their information assets residing on-premise, in the Cloud and across social networks.</p><br><b>Job Description:</b><br><p><strong>Our Team</strong><br />Informatica Professional Services (IPS) ensures our customers are successful in deploying our data integration and analytic platforms. Our consultants work with our customers and business partners both on short-term assignments to provide spot, Informatica expertise, as well as longer-term efforts to ensure we deliver a decision support project in accordance with the customer&apos;s expectations. <br /><br /><strong>Your Opportunity</strong><br />Informatica Professional Services is seeking qualified individuals for the role of Technical Delivery Manager (TDM) in the EMEA MDM Practice. As part of the MDM Practice, the Technical Delivery Manager is responsible for providing technical leadership and management skills to drive successful engagements and adoption of global initiatives and best practices across the region. This role can be based in either Stuttgart or Frankfurt.<br /><br /><strong>Our Ideal Candidate</strong><br />The TDM will work closely with various teams including IPS Regional Managers, Local Sales Teams, PMO, Partners, Customers and other Team Members to support opportunity development and drive successful service engagements. The TDM is ultimately responsible for the leadership, financial management, quality, and timely delivery of the project for our customer.<br />During the course of a client engagement, the TDM will be expected to:<br />• Act as Project Manager for the overall initiative when there is no Project Manager assigned from the customer’s organization<br />• Liaise with architects, technical teams, and leadership (both business and IT) across the customer’s organization<br />• Provide the single point of contact for resolution of project related issues<br />• Act as the primary interface point into Informatica’s broader technical teams to ensure the full breadth and depth of the Informatica organization is leveraged for the customer’s success<br />• Communicate overall project status to the customer and to Informatica Professional Services management on a regular basis <br />• Lead project meetings, including project kick-off, project status, steering committee, and other project stage gate meetings <br />• Provide overall project leadership and direct project teams in the delivery of high-quality products within committed timeframes and budgets<br />• Work with project team members to define project tasks and milestones, and coordinate the alignment of dependencies both within the project and across other projects<br />• Ensure complete understanding of the project estimates and project scope in order to lead the team to deliver within the boundaries of the given estimates and assumptions<br />• Manage customer expectations regarding project scope, timelines, and deliverables<br />• Coordinate with project team members and partners to ensure the right resources are working on the right tasks at the right time, with clear expectations of milestones and goals<br />• Mentor project team members on Velocity methodology and drive utilization of consistent processes and deliverables<br />Technical Delivery Managers are looked to as leaders and experts in the delivery of MDM initiatives, both by the customers they serve and within Informatica Professional Services (IPS). For customers, this means the TDM is expected to leverage their technical domain expertise to drive project delivery, lead the project team, clearly set and manage customer expectations, and proactively address and resolve project related issues. Within IPS, TDMs will help drive utilization of common standards and processes across the Practice. They will also be expected to actively participate in continuous improvement of PMO deliverables, make refinements and additions to the Velocity methodology, contribute to the IPS Knowledgebase, and coach/mentor other colleagues within the Practice. <br /></p><br><b>Qualifications:</b><br><p><br />• Must possess combination of technical depth, written/verbal communication, project management, and client management skills<br />• Must possess extensive analytical skills<br />• Self-sufficiency in problem solving and knowledge acquisition from resources throughout the company<br />• Exceptional interpersonal, organizational and communication skills (written &amp; verbal)<br />• Excellent presentation skills and strong negotiation skills<br />• Ability to anticipate and build contingency plans<br />• Expert Project Management skills including: estimating, scope management, budget management, time management, risk management, change management, issue/conflict resolution, communication management, quality management, testing plans, training plans, team management<br />• Skills and knowledge acquired through participation in the delivery of data integration initiatives in each of the following areas: change management, release management, configuration management, systems integration, systems development life cycle methodologies, quality assurance and testing, requirements gathering, and systems analysis and design<br />• 10+ years’ industry experience and 3+ years project delivery experience managing large or complex MDM projects as a Project Manager or Technical Lead, <br />• Bachelors degree or equivalent experience<br />• Working knowledge of Informatica Master Data Management or similar technologies <br />• Strong history and track record of completing quality projects on time, as well as a proven track record coaching and mentoring others to success<br />• Ability to handle stressful situations with perseverance and professionalism<br />• Fluent in GERMAN and English<br />• Bachelors degree or equivalent experience<br />• Willingness to travel up to 75%<br /></p><br>"}

{"actual":"","id":"56950704034812b965f87e30","key":"Regeneron Genetics Center"}
{"actual":"","id":"56950704034812b965f87e30","key":"<br><b>Job Summary and Essential Functions:</b></br><p dir=\"ltr\"><font style=\"font-size:11px;\"><font style=\"color:undefined;font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif;size:undefined;\">The Regeneron Genetics Center is a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company organized to collaborate with health systems and research groups to elucidate, on a large scale, genetic factors that cause or influence a range of human diseases.&nbsp; Building upon Regeneron's strengths in mouse genetics and genetics-driven drug discovery and development, the Center will specialize in ultra-high-throughput exome sequencing and computational biology; discovery of genotype-phenotype associations through linkage to well-annotated de-identified patient electronic medical records; and validation of discoveries using Regeneron’s VelociGene® technology.&nbsp; Our interests encompass a breadth of different areas such as Mendelian and family frameworks, large-scale population genetics (both common and rare variants), and gene-gene interactions.&nbsp; Program goals include target discovery, indication discovery, and patient-disease stratification.&nbsp; Objectives include advancing basic science around the world through public sharing of discoveries, providing clinically-valuable insights to physicians and patients of collaborating health-care systems, and identifying novel targets for drug development.<br><br>Summary:<br>The Analytical Genetics group inside the Regeneron Genetics Center is seeking individuals with strong genomic analytical and managerial skills to join a team of outstanding investigators to manage a group responsible for the analysis and interpretation of multiple datasets involving clinical and phenotypic data for genetics studies. The overall mission of the Regeneron Genetics Center is to drive and leverage genomic discoveries to inform development of therapeutic targets.&nbsp; Responsibilities will be to direct, organize and participate in the analysis of large-scale clinical and phenotypic datasets, including de-identified EMR extracts, data from epidemiological studies with deep phenotyping in selected areas of interest, and in founder populations. Command of common statistical genetic tools used in contemporary studies required, as well as experience in extended methods using multivariate analysis, survival analysis, longitudinal data, pathways, and interactions to further genetic discovery.&nbsp; Expertise in family and haplotype analysis is desirable. The candidate should have managerial experience either in industry or in academia, have great organizational skills, and have excellent problem solving capabilitieis.&nbsp; Candidates with credentials and experience in genomic analysis from the perspectives of Biostatistics, Bioinformatics, Population Genetics, or Epidemiology preferred.&nbsp; The position reports to the Head of Analytical Genetics and will require coordination and collaboration with other scientists within the department, research and clinical scientists at Regeneron, and external collaborators.&nbsp;<br>&nbsp;<br>&nbsp;This position will provide exciting opportunities for collaboration leveraging a vast amount of data encompassing thousands of phenotypes derived from electronic medical records, integrated with genomic data, epidemiological studies, and founder populations. Together, these represent a landmark collection of information that will move precision medicine and novel therapeutic discovery forward as a new data-driven paradigm in healthcare.&nbsp;<br><br>Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:<br><br>- Manage a team of bioinformaticists, genetic epidemiologists, and programmers to drive and coordinate the analysis of data from multiple health system partners.<br>- &nbsp;To coordinate with the department head on analytic priorities, deliverables, and timelines.<br>- To engage in QC and review of results, design of customized followup analyses to extend understanding of the underlying genetic architecture, development of reports and presentations.<br>- Thought leadership on best practices, and extending and improving our analytical approaches; interaction with the model development group.<br>- Thought leadership on evaluation of study results.<br>- Interactions with leaders in other parts of the company within their therapeutic focus areas to develop approaches and genomic evidence to inform their activities.<br>- Communicate findings clearly to diverse stakeholders and document work for training and replication purposes.<br>- Prepare manuscripts for publication.</font></font></p><br><b>Experience and Required Skills:</b></br><p dir=\"ltr\"><font style=\"font-size:11px;\"><font style=\"color:undefined;font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif;size:undefined;\">Requirements:<br>This position requires a PhD or Master's degree in Epidemiology, Statistics, Biostatistics, Public Health, or other relevant analytical/data field, and a minimum of 10 years data analysis experience, and 5 years experience managing a small team.&nbsp; Experience with analysis of large genetic data sets required. Additional requirements include:<br>- Experience with HIPAA-compliant data use and IRB.<br>- Proficiency in principles and practice of statistical analysis and in major statistical analysis packages and languages; experience with R.<br>-&nbsp; Experience with mainstream software packages in genetic epidemiology for genomewide association scans, meta-analysis, rare variants analysis including variant-wise and gene-wise tests, imputation, haplotyping and family-based methods.<br>- Experience designing and performing epidemiological association studies, including survival analysis, longitudinal data analysis, multivariate regression, propensity score generation and matching, instrumental variable analysis, sensitivity analysis, and Mendelian randomization.<br>- Experience working with genomic and bioinformatics investigators is preferred.<br>- Ability to multitask and manage simultaneous projects to meet deadlines with a strong attention to detail.<br>- Ability to interpret and communicate analytical results in a clear, concise manner, and integrate results and develop scientific narratives.<br>- Strong commitment to advancing company goals in a team science environment.<br><br>Level commensurate with experience</font></font></p><br><br>This is an opportunity to join our select team that is already leading the way in the Pharmaceutical/Biotech industry. Apply today and learn more about Regeneron Genetics Center’s unwavering commitment to combining good science &amp; good business.<br><br>To all agencies: Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of Regeneron or the Regeneron Genetics Center about this opening.&nbsp; All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee at Regeneron or the Regeneron Genetics Center via-email, the internet or in any form and/or method will be deemed the sole property of the Regeneron Genetics Center, unless such search firms/employment agencies were engaged by Regeneron or the Regeneron Genetics Center for this position and a valid agreement with either Regeneron or the Regeneron Genetics Center is in place.&nbsp; In the event a candidate who was submitted outside of the Regeneron or Regeneron Genetics Center agency engagement process is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.<br><br>RGC is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law."}

font-size: small\"><strong>Job Summary:</strong>&nbsp;The cashier position is vital to achieving positive customer service and is responsible for successfully completing the financial transaction with the customer and maintaining the balance of the cash drawer at all times.</span></p>\n        <p style=\"margin: 0px\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small\">&nbsp;</span></p>\n        <p style=\"margin: 0px\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small\"><strong>Essential Tasks and Responsibilities:</strong></span></p>\n        <ul>\n         <li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small\">Maintain a positive attitude and smile</span></li>\n         <li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small\">Greet customers as they approach the cash register and be polite with customers during the transaction</span></li>\n         <li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small\">Must have knowledge of cash register, credit card machines, and Aramark cashier policy in order to effectively service the customer</span></li>\n         <li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small\">Maintain an organized, neat and clean cashier station</span></li>\n         <li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small\">Stock service areas with paper goods, condiments, beverages, and food items as needed</span></li>\n         <li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small\">Count, organize, and balance the cash drawer; fill out the cashier slip; and make deposits while in the presence of a manager or supervisor</span></li>\n         <li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small\">Distribute promotional material and customer loyalty rewards as necessary</span></li>\n         <li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small\">Monitor theft in the location and report incidents to managers</span></li>\n         <li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small\">Assist with daily functions in the kitchen, food court, or dining room during down time</span></li>\n         <li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small\">Must be able to stand for extended periods of time</span></li>\n         <li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;\">Be able to work quickly and concisely under pressure</span></li>\n         <li><span style=\"font-family: arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size: small;\">Understand what is inclusive of a reimbursable meal</span></li>\n         <li><span style=\"font-family: arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size: small;\">Ensure storage of food in a proper and sanitary manner</span></li>\n         <li><span style=\"font-family: arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size: small;\">Organize and assist in major cleaning of refrigerators, freezers, and cooking and serving equipment at the regularly scheduled intervals</span></li>\n         <li><span style=\"font-family: arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size: small;\">Ensure food items and supplies are checked in as they arrive</span></li>\n         <li><span style=\"font-family: arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size: small;\">Ensure daily cleaning and sterilization of all dishes, silverware, and cooking utensils</span></li>\n         <li><span style=\"font-family: arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size: small;\">Proper utilization of leftovers as required</span></li>\n         <li><span style=\"font-family: arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size: small;\">Maintain a constant sense of cost control</span></li>\n         <li><span style=\"font-family: arial,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size: small;\">Measure and mix ingredients according to standardized recipes using blenders, mixers, grinders, slicers, and other preparation equipment to prepare entrees, soups, salads, sandwiches, gravies, desserts, sauces, casseroles, and other food items</span></li>\n         <li><span style=\"font-family: arial,helvetica,sans-serif; {"actual":"","id":"56a0b856e4b0c1bb93610fa9","key":"<p style=\"MARGIN: 1em 0px\"><b style=\"mso-bidi-font-weight: normal\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">Elevating the Possibility of U at UCHealth </span></b></p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 1em 0px\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\"></span>&nbsp;</p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 1em 0px\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">UCHealth is a special place and it requires a special type of person to work here. We are committed to attracting exceptional people who possess a rare combination of talent, drive, and intellectual curiosity. They are the people who naturally gravitate toward our culture, our geography, and our passion for discovery -- ambitious people for whom UCHealth isn't just a career, but an elevated state of mind.</span></p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 1em 0px; LINE-HEIGHT: normal\"><b style=\"mso-bidi-font-weight: normal\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\"><font size=\"3\" face=\"Times New Roman\"><br></font>Summary - <span style=\"mso-spacerun: yes\">&nbsp;</span>CT Technologist<span style=\"mso-spacerun: yes\">&nbsp; </span></span></b></p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 1em 0px; LINE-HEIGHT: normal\"><b style=\"mso-bidi-font-weight: normal\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\"></span></b>&nbsp;</p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 1em 0px; LINE-HEIGHT: normal\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">Provides computed tomography imaging in accordance with applicable scope and standards of practice and with the policies, values, and mission of the organization.</span></p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 1em 0px; LINE-HEIGHT: normal\"><b style=\"mso-bidi-font-weight: normal\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\"></span></b>&nbsp;</p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 1em 0px; LINE-HEIGHT: normal\"><b style=\"mso-bidi-font-weight: normal\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">Job Duties </span></b></p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: normal; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; -ms-text-autospace: \"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol\"><span style=\"mso-list: Ignore\">·<span style=\"FONT: 7pt &quot;Times New Roman&quot;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">Reviews patient history and physician's orders. Educates patient regarding procedures, equipment and exam to ensure patient's understanding and cooperation. </span></p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: normal; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; -ms-text-autospace: \"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol\"><span style=\"mso-list: Ignore\">·<span style=\"FONT: 7pt &quot;Times New Roman&quot;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">When ordered, prepares and administers contrast media and/or medications within scope of practice. Monitors patient condition continually and reports/responds to changes in status as appropriate. Prepares equipment and supplies. </span></p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: normal; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; -ms-text-autospace: \"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol\"><span style=\"mso-list: Ignore\">·<span style=\"FONT: 7pt &quot;Times New Roman&quot;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">Selects appropriate exposure factors and imaging parameters. Implements safety standards and performs appropriate quality control procedures on equipment. Troubleshoots, resolves, and/or reports equipment malfunctions as necessary. </span></p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: normal; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; -ms-text-autospace: \"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol\"><span style=\"mso-list: Ignore\">·<span style=\"FONT: 7pt &quot;Times New Roman&quot;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">Positions patient and performs imaging procedure(s). Analyzes results and identifies issues with the quality of imaging results. </span></p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: normal; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; -ms-text-autospace: \"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol\"><span style=\"mso-list: Ignore\">·<span style=\"FONT: 7pt &quot;Times New Roman&quot;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">Takes appropriate action to resolve image quality issues, including repositioning patient and repeating procedure. Enters, transmits and reports scan results.</span></p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: normal; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; -ms-text-autospace: \"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol\"><span style=\"mso-list: Ignore\">·<span style=\"FONT: 7pt &quot;Times New Roman&quot;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">Within scope of job, requires critical thinking skills, decisive judgment and the ability to work with minimal supervision. Must be able to work in a fast paced environment, and take appropriate action. Follows Standard Precautions using personal protective equipment as required.<br style=\"mso-special-character: line-break\"><br style=\"mso-special-character: line-break\"></span></p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: normal; -ms-text-autospace: \"><b style=\"mso-bidi-font-weight: normal\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">Requirements</span></b><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\"> </span></p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: normal; -ms-text-autospace: \"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\"></span>&nbsp;</p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: normal; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol\"><span style=\"mso-list: Ignore\">·<span style=\"FONT: 7pt &quot;Times New Roman&quot;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">Graduate of an accredited Radiologic Technologist program.</span></p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: normal; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol\"><span style=\"mso-list: Ignore\">·<span style=\"FONT: 7pt &quot;Times New Roman&quot;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">Registered as a Radiologic Technologist (RT) and registered, and or registry eligible with completion of registry in 12 months in computed tomography (CT) by the American Registry of Radiologic Technologists (ARRT). State licensure if required by law.</span></p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: normal; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol\"><span style=\"mso-list: Ignore\">·<span style=\"FONT: 7pt &quot;Times New Roman&quot;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">Basic Life Support (BLS) through the American Heart Association or the American Red Cross CPR for the Professional Rescuer with card in-hand before start date.&nbsp; BLS or CPR card must be good through sixty days of hire.&nbsp; All life support certification cards must be issued by either the American Heart Association or the American Red Cross CPR for the Professional Rescuer. (American Red Cross for the Professional Rescuer is only good upon hire and all renewals will need to be through an American Heart Association sanctioned course).</span></p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: normal\"><b style=\"mso-bidi-font-weight: normal\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\"><font size=\"3\" face=\"Times New Roman\"><br></font>Preferred</span></b></p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: normal\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\"></span>&nbsp;</p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 10pt 0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: normal; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol\"><span style=\"mso-list: Ignore\">·<span style=\"FONT: 7pt &quot;Times New Roman&quot;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">1 year of related experience.</span></p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 1em 0px; LINE-HEIGHT: normal\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif; COLOR: black\">With award-winning hospitals and facilities serving the entire Front Range, University of Colorado Health is the state's largest and most innovative health system. By integrating the strengths of academic medicine with the finest community health care, we're able to push the boundaries of medicine and offer our employees endless career opportunities.</span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\"> <span style=\"COLOR: black\">Here, there are no limits, except those you place on yourself. Everyone is united by their passion for discovery and their commitment to improving patients' lives.</span></span></p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 1em 0px; LINE-HEIGHT: normal\"><b style=\"mso-bidi-font-weight: normal\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\"></span></b>&nbsp;</p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 1em 0px; LINE-HEIGHT: normal\"><b style=\"mso-bidi-font-weight: normal\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">Join Us. Together We Improve lives.</span></b></p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 1em 0px; LINE-HEIGHT: normal\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\"></span>&nbsp;</p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 1em 0px; LINE-HEIGHT: normal\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">The University of Colorado Health (UCHealth) system </span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif; mso-fareast-font-family: Arial\">recognizes and appreciates the rich array of talents and perspectives that equal employment and diversity can offer our institution.&nbsp; As an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer, UCHealth is committed to making all employment decisions based on valid requirements.&nbsp; No applicant shall be discriminated against in any terms, conditions or privileges of employment or otherwise be discriminated against because of the individual's race, creed, color, religion, gender, national origin or ancestry, age, mental or physical disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or veteran status.&nbsp; UCHealth does not discriminate against any \"qualified applicant with a disability\" as defined under the Americans with Disabilities Act and will make reasonable accommodations, when they do not impose an undue</span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\"> hardship on the organization.</span></p> \n<p> </p>"}

FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial',sans-serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt\">Collects and processes blood specimens for testing in the laboratory.</span></p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 10pt\"><b style=\"mso-bidi-font-weight: normal\"><span style=\"LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol\"><span style=\"mso-list: Ignore\">·<span style=\"FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style=\"LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial',sans-serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt\">Collects blood specimens using age-appropriate techniques. </span></p> \n<p style=\"TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in\"><span style=\"LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol\"><span style=\"mso-list: Ignore\">·<span style=\"FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style=\"LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial',sans-serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt\">Labels, processes and delivers specimens for testing. </span></p> \n<p style=\"TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; </span></span></span><span style=\"LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial',sans-serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt\">Maintains supplies and equipment. </span></p> \n<p style=\"TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in\"><span style=\"LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; </span></span></span><span style=\"LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial',sans-serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt\">Performs clerical tasks as necessary or assigned, including answering calls and entering data.</span></p> \n<p style=\"TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; </span></span></span><span style=\"LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial',sans-serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt\">Within scope of job, requires critical thinking skills, decisive judgment and the ability to work with minimal supervision. Must be able to work in a fast paced environment, and take appropriate action. Follows Standard Precautions using personal protective equipment as required.</span></p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 10pt 0.5in\"><span style=\"LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial',sans-serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt\"></span>&nbsp;</p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 10pt\"><b style=\"mso-bidi-font-weight: normal\"><span style=\"LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial',sans-serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt\">Requirements</span></b><span style=\"LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial',sans-serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt\"> </span></p> \n<p style=\"TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in\"><span style=\"LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol\"><span style=\"mso-list: Ignore\">·<span style=\"FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style=\"LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial',sans-serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt\">High School diploma or GED.</span></p> \n<p style=\"TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; MARGIN: 0in 0in 10pt 0.5in\"><span style=\"LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol\"><span style=\"mso-list: Ignore\">·<span style=\"FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style=\"LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial',sans-serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt\">Certified as a Phlebotomy Technician by the American Society for Clinical Pathology (ASCP) or equivalent within one year of hire or eligibility. State licensure if required by law. {"actual":"","id":"56a0b856e4b0c1bb93610fac","key":"<p style=\"MARGIN: 1em 0px\"><b style=\"mso-bidi-font-weight: normal\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">Elevating the Possibility of U at UCHealth </span></b></p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 1em 0px\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\"></span>&nbsp;</p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 1em 0px\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">UCHealth is a special place and it requires a special type of person to work here. LINE-HEIGHT: normal\"><b style=\"mso-bidi-font-weight: normal\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\"></span></b>&nbsp;</p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 1em 0px; LINE-HEIGHT: normal\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">Responsible for accurate delivery of prescribed radiation therapy treatment by delivering ionizing radiation to patients.</span></p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 1em 0px; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">Job Duties </span></b></p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: normal; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; -ms-text-autospace: \"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol\"><span style=\"mso-list: Ignore\">·<span style=\"FONT: 7pt &quot;Times New Roman&quot;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">Independently administers medications per licensure authority, assess and reassesses the effects of these medications, and documents administration in a timely manner per policies, procedures and regulatory requirements. </span></p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: normal; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; -ms-text-autospace: \"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol\"><span style=\"mso-list: Ignore\">·<span style=\"FONT: 7pt &quot;Times New Roman&quot;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">Consistently adheres to patient safety guidelines regarding all aspects of medication administration. Schedules patient treatments; explains radiation therapy procedures to patients. Acquires and maintains skills in simulation, compensator/block construction and hyperthermia treatment. </span></p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: normal; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; -ms-text-autospace: \"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol\"><span style=\"mso-list: Ignore\">·<span style=\"FONT: 7pt &quot;Times New Roman&quot;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">Provides education and technical demonstrations to students, nursing staff, residents and other health care professionals; assists in orienting and mentoring staff. </span></p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: normal; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; -ms-text-autospace: \"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol\"><span style=\"mso-list: Ignore\">·<span style=\"FONT: 7pt &quot;Times New Roman&quot;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">Assists with the quality control and maintenance of designated equipment and supplies. Maintains stock levels of supplies and materials. Performs minor repairs/troubleshooting. Reports major malfunctions to supervisor/manager. Responsible for knowing and demonstrating National Patient Safety standards. </span></p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: normal; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; -ms-text-autospace: \"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol\"><span style=\"mso-list: Ignore\">·<span style=\"FONT: 7pt &quot;Times New Roman&quot;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">Participates in department-based activities and initiatives to improve and ensure a safe environment. Participates in performance improvement activities; quality improvement and patient safety activities; assists in maintaining compliance with Joint Commission accreditation and other internal and external regulatory standards including the code of conduct.</span></p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; </span></span></span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">Ability to exercise a high level of technical judgment and skill in performing procedures.<br style=\"mso-special-character: line-break\"><br style=\"mso-special-character: line-break\"></span></p> \n<p style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; Together We Improve lives.</span></b></p> \n<p style=\"LINE-HEIGHT: normal; MARGIN: 1em 0px\"><span style=\"FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial',sans-serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt\"></span>&nbsp;</p> \n<p style=\"LINE-HEIGHT: normal; MARGIN: 1em 0px\"><span style=\"FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial',sans-serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt\">The University of Colorado Health (UCHealth) system </span><span style=\"FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial',sans-serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Arial\">recognizes and appreciates the rich array of talents and perspectives that equal employment and diversity can offer our institution.&nbsp; As an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer, UCHealth is committed to making all employment decisions based on valid requirements.&nbsp; No applicant shall be discriminated against in any terms, conditions or privileges of employment or otherwise be discriminated against because of the individual's race, creed, color, religion, gender, national origin or ancestry, age, mental or physical disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or veteran status.&nbsp; UCHealth does not discriminate against any \"qualified applicant with a disability\" as defined under the Americans with Disabilities Act and will make reasonable accommodations, when they do not impose an undue</span><span style=\"FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial',sans-serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt\"> hardship on the organization.</span></p> \n<p> </p>"}

We are committed to attracting exceptional people who possess a rare combination of talent, drive, and intellectual curiosity. They are the people who naturally gravitate toward our culture, our geography, and our passion for discovery -- ambitious people for whom UCHealth isn't just a career, but an elevated state of mind.\n  <o:p></o:p></span></p> \n<p class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 10pt\"><b style=\"mso-bidi-font-weight: normal\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; </span></span></span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;,sans-serif\">Reviews patient history and physician's orders. </span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">\n  <o:p></o:p></span></p> \n<p class=\"MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle\" style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;,sans-serif\">Prepares equipment and supplies. </span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">\n  <o:p></o:p></span></p> \n<p class=\"MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle\" style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;,sans-serif\">Analyzes results and identifies issues with the quality of imaging results. Takes appropriate action to resolve image quality issues, including repositioning patient and repeating procedure. Enters, transmits and reports scan results.</span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">\n  <o:p></o:p></span></p> \n<p class=\"MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle\" style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-AUTOSPACE: ; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; mso-layout-grid-align: none; mso-list: l1 level1 lfo1\"><span style=\"FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol\"><span style=\"mso-list: Ignore\"><font size=\"3\">·</font><span style=\"FONT: 7pt &quot;Times New Roman&quot;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;,sans-serif; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%\">Graduate of an accredited&nbsp;Ultrasound Technologist program or Diagnostic Medical Sonographer program</span><span style=\"mso-bidi-font-family: Calibri; mso-ascii-font-family: Calibri; mso-hansi-font-family: Calibri\">\n  <o:p></o:p></span></p> \n<p class=\"MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle\" style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; TEXT-AUTOSPACE: ; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol\"><span style=\"mso-list: Ignore\">·<span style=\"FONT: 7pt &quot;Times New Roman&quot;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;,sans-serif; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%\">Registered as a Diagnostic Medical Sonographer (RDMS), Vascular Technologist (RVT), or Diagnostic Cardiac Sonographer (RDCS)&nbsp;by the American Registry for Diagnostic Medical Sonography (ARDMS) or registered as a Technologist (RT) and certified in sonography (S) by the American Registry of Radiologic Technologists (ARRT). State licensure if required by law.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition must hold three certifications (for level 1) or must hold four or more certifications (for level 2).</span><b style=\"mso-bidi-font-weight: normal\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%\">\n   <o:p></o:p></span></b></p> \n<p class=\"MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle\" style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; mso-list: l1 level1 lfo1; mso-add-space: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol\"><span style=\"mso-list: Ignore\">·<span style=\"FONT: 7pt &quot;Times New Roman&quot;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;,sans-serif; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%\">BLS through the American Heart Association or the American Red Cross CPR for the Professional Rescuer with card in-hand before start date.<span style=\"mso-spacerun: yes\">&nbsp; </span>BLS or CPR card must be good through sixty days of hire.<span style=\"mso-spacerun: yes\">&nbsp; </span>All life support certification cards must be issued by either the American Heart Association or the American Red Cross CPR for the Professional Rescuer. (American Red Cross for the Professional Rescuer is only good upon hire and all renewals will need to be through an American Heart Association sanctioned course.)\n  <o:p></o:p></span></p> \n<p class=\"MsoListParagraphCxSpLast\" style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-add-space: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto\"><b style=\"mso-bidi-font-weight: normal\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%\"><br></span></b><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%\">With award-winning hospitals and facilities serving the entire Front Range, University of Colorado Health is the state's largest and most innovative health system. By integrating the strengths of academic medicine with the finest community health care, we're able to push the boundaries of medicine and offer our employees endless career opportunities. Here, there are no limits, except those you place on yourself. Everyone is united by their passion for discovery and their commitment to improving patients' lives.</span><span style=\"mso-bidi-font-family: Calibri; mso-ascii-font-family: Calibri; mso-hansi-font-family: Calibri\">\n  <o:p></o:p></span></p> \n<p class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 10pt\"><b style=\"mso-bidi-font-weight: normal\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%\">Join Us. Together We Improve lives.\n   <o:p></o:p></span></b></p> \n<p class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 10pt\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%\">The University of Colorado Health (UCHealth) system </span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; mso-fareast-font-family: Arial\">recognizes and appreciates the rich array of talents and perspectives that equal employment and diversity can offer our institution.&nbsp; As an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer, UCHealth is committed to making all employment decisions based on valid requirements.&nbsp; No applicant shall be discriminated against in any terms, conditions or privileges of employment or otherwise be discriminated against because of the individual's race, creed, color, religion, gender, national origin or ancestry, age, mental or physical disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or veteran status.&nbsp; UCHealth does not discriminate against any \"qualified applicant with a disability\" as defined under the Americans with Disabilities Act and will make reasonable accommodations, when they do not impose an undue</span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%\"> hardship on the organization.\n  <o:p></o:p></span></p> \n<p> </p>"}

FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;,sans-serif\">When ordered, prepares and administers contrast media and/or medications within scope of practice.</span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">\n  <o:p></o:p></span></p> \n<p class=\"MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle\" style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: normal; TEXT-AUTOSPACE: ; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo2; mso-add-space: auto; mso-layout-grid-align: none\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol\"><span style=\"mso-list: Ignore\">·<span style=\"FONT: 7pt &quot;Times New Roman&quot;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;,sans-serif\"><span style=\"mso-spacerun: yes\">&nbsp;</span>Monitors patient condition continually and reports/responds to changes in status as appropriate. </span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">\n  <o:p></o:p></span></p> \n<p class=\"MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle\" style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: normal; TEXT-AUTOSPACE: ; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo2; mso-add-space: auto; mso-layout-grid-align: none\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol\"><span style=\"mso-list: Ignore\">·<span style=\"FONT: 7pt &quot;Times New Roman&quot;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;,sans-serif\">Prepares equipment and supplies. Selects appropriate exposure factors and imaging parameters.</span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">\n  <o:p></o:p></span></p> \n<p class=\"MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle\" style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: normal; TEXT-AUTOSPACE: ; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo2; mso-add-space: auto; mso-layout-grid-align: none\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol\"><span style=\"mso-list: Ignore\">·<span style=\"FONT: 7pt &quot;Times New Roman&quot;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;,sans-serif\"><span style=\"mso-spacerun: yes\">&nbsp;</span>Implements safety standards and performs appropriate quality control procedures on equipment. Troubleshoots, resolves, and/or reports equipment malfunctions as necessary. </span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">\n  <o:p></o:p></span></p> \n<p class=\"MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle\" style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: normal; TEXT-AUTOSPACE: ; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo2; mso-add-space: auto; mso-layout-grid-align: none\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol\"><span style=\"mso-list: Ignore\">·<span style=\"FONT: 7pt &quot;Times New Roman&quot;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;,sans-serif\">Positions patient and performs imaging procedure(s). Analyzes results and identifies issues with the quality of imaging results. Takes appropriate action to resolve image quality issues, including repositioning patient and repeating procedure. Enters, transmits and reports&nbsp;scan results</span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">\n  <o:p></o:p></span></p> \n<p class=\"MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle\" style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-AUTOSPACE: ; mso-add-space: auto; mso-layout-grid-align: none\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%\"><br><b style=\"mso-bidi-font-weight: normal\"><span style=\"mso-spacerun: yes\">&nbsp;</span>Requirements</b> \n  <o:p></o:p></span></p> \n<p class=\"MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle\" style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; mso-margin-top-alt: auto; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-list: l1 level1 lfo1; mso-add-space: auto\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol\"><span style=\"mso-list: Ignore\">·<span style=\"FONT: 7pt &quot;Times New Roman&quot;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;,sans-serif; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%\">Graduate of an accredited Radiologic Technologist program.</span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%\">\n  <o:p></o:p></span></p> \n<p class=\"MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle\" style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; mso-margin-top-alt: auto; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-list: l1 level1 lfo1; mso-add-space: auto\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol\"><span style=\"mso-list: Ignore\">·<span style=\"FONT: 7pt &quot;Times New Roman&quot;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;,sans-serif; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%\">Registered as a Technologist (RT) and registered in magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) or registry eligible with completing of registry within 12 months by the American Registry of Radiologic Technologists (ARRT (Radiography). State licensure if required by law. .</span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%\">\n  <o:p></o:p></span></p> \n<p class=\"MsoListParagraphCxSpLast\" style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 10pt 0.5in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; mso-margin-top-alt: auto; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-list: l1 level1 lfo1; mso-add-space: auto\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol\"><span style=\"mso-list: Ignore\">·<span style=\"FONT: 7pt &quot;Times New Roman&quot;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;,sans-serif; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%\">BLS through the American Heart Association or the American Red Cross CPR for the Professional Rescuer with card in-hand before start date.<span style=\"mso-spacerun: yes\">&nbsp; </span>BLS or CPR card must be good through sixty days of hire.<span style=\"mso-spacerun: yes\">&nbsp; </span>All life support certification cards must be issued by either the American Heart Association or the American Red Cross CPR for the Professional Rescuer. (American Red Cross for the Professional Rescuer is only good upon hire and all renewals will need to be through an American Heart Association sanctioned course.)\n  <o:p></o:p></span></p> \n<p class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 10pt\"><b style=\"mso-bidi-font-weight: normal\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%\"><br></span></b><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif; COLOR: black; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%\">With award-winning hospitals and facilities serving the entire Front Range, University of Colorado Health is the state's largest and most innovative health system. By integrating the strengths of academic medicine with the finest community health care, we're able to push the boundaries of medicine and offer our employees endless career opportunities.</span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%\"> <span style=\"COLOR: black\">Here, there are no limits, except those you place on yourself. Everyone is united by their passion for discovery and their commitment to improving patients' lives.</span></span><span style=\"mso-bidi-font-family: Calibri; mso-ascii-font-family: Calibri; mso-hansi-font-family: Calibri\">\n  <o:p></o:p></span></p> \n<p class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 10pt\"><b style=\"mso-bidi-font-weight: normal\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%\">Join Us. Together We Improve lives.\n   <o:p></o:p></span></b></p> \n<p class=\"MsoNormalCxSpLast\" style=\"LINE-HEIGHT: normal\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">The University of Colorado Health (UCHealth) system recognizes and appreciates the rich array of talents and perspectives that equal employment and diversity can offer our institution.<span style=\"mso-spacerun: yes\">&nbsp; </span>As an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer, UCHealth is committed to making all employment decisions based on valid requirements.<span style=\"mso-spacerun: yes\">&nbsp; </span>No applicant shall be discriminated against in any terms, conditions or privileges of employment or otherwise be discriminated against because of the individual's race, creed, color, religion, gender, national origin or ancestry, age, mental or physical disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or veteran status.<span style=\"mso-spacerun: yes\">&nbsp; </span>UCHealth does not discriminate against any \"qualified applicant with a disability\" as defined under the Americans with Disabilities Act and will make reasonable accommodations, when they do not impose an undue hardship on the organization.\n  <o:p></o:p></span></p> \n<p class=\"MsoListParagraph\" style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-top-alt: auto; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-add-space: auto\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif; LINE-HEIGHT: 115%\">.\n  <o:p></o:p></span></p> \n<p> </p>"}

</span></span></span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;,sans-serif\">Reviews patient history and physician's orders. </span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">\n  <o:p></o:p></span></p> \n<p class=\"MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle\" style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; </span></span></span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;,sans-serif\">Prepares equipment and supplies. Selects appropriate exposure factors and imaging parameters.</span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">\n  <o:p></o:p></span></p> \n<p class=\"MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle\" style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: normal; TEXT-AUTOSPACE: ; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; mso-layout-grid-align: none; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo2; mso-add-space: auto\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol\"><span style=\"mso-list: Ignore\">·<span style=\"FONT: 7pt &quot;Times New Roman&quot;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;,sans-serif\"><span style=\"mso-spacerun: yes\">&nbsp;</span>Implements safety standards and performs appropriate quality control procedures on equipment. Troubleshoots, resolves, and/or reports equipment malfunctions as necessary. </span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif\">\n  <o:p></o:p></span></p> \n<p class=\"MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle\" style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: normal; TEXT-AUTOSPACE: ; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; mso-layout-grid-align: none; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo2; mso-add-space: auto\"><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-bidi-font-family: Symbol; mso-fareast-font-family: Symbol\"><span style=\"mso-list: Ignore\">·<span style=\"FONT: 7pt &quot;Times New Roman&quot;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style=\"FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;,sans-serif\">Positions patient and performs imaging procedure(s). LINE-HEIGHT: 115%\">\n  <o:p></o:p></span></p> \n<p class=\"MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle\" style=\"MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; mso-list: l1 level1 lfo1; mso-add-space: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;
