{"actual":"","id":"56a0b856e4b0c1bb93610fcf","key":"<p class=\"MsoPlainText\"><b><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">Elevating the Possibility of U at UCHealth \n   <o:p></o:p></font></b></p> \n<p> </p>\n<p class=\"MsoPlainText\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">&nbsp;</font></p> \n<p> </p>\n<p class=\"MsoPlainText\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">UCHealth is a special place and it requires a special type of person to work here. We are committed to attracting exceptional people who possess a rare combination of talent, drive, and intellectual curiosity. They are the people who naturally gravitate toward our culture, our geography, and our passion for discovery -- ambitious people for whom UCHealth isn't just a career, but an elevated state of mind.\n  <o:p></o:p></font></p> \n<p> </p>\n<p class=\"MsoPlainText\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">&nbsp;</font></p> \n<p> </p>\n<p class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt\"><b><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">Summary:\n   <o:p></o:p></font></b></p> \n<p> </p>\n<p class=\"MsoPlainText\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\"><span lang=\"EN\">Under RN supervision, functions to assist the nursing staffing diversified duties in the delivery of patient care and support activities. Collaborates with other members of the patient care team to promote holistic patient care. Must demonstrate competency in all of the following: collection and documentation of vital signs, intakes and outputs, weights, and other measurements as delegated; activities of daily living; activity support and clerical duties. May also be required to demonstrate competency in any of the following as defined by specific unit: POCT, set-up/assist with procedures, phlebotomy, tube feedings, vital records, and retail sales. May also be required to demonstrate competency in any of the following, as defined by the specific critical care unit: collection and documentation of weights, intake and output, and other measurements; phlebotomy, spinal immobilization, POCT, EKG monitoring, performing 12 lead EKGs, set-up/assist with procedures, and tube feedings. Reports timely, accurate and pertinent information to RNs throughout the shift. Performs order entry/transcription, maintains medical records, maintains supplies and equipment, and ensures unit-specific patient charges. May be utilized as a core trainer in the orientation of new staff.</span>\n  <o:p></o:p></font></p> \n<p> </p>\n<p class=\"MsoPlainText\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">&nbsp;</font></p> \n<p> </p>\n<p class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt\"><b><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">Job duties:\n   <o:p></o:p></font></b></p> \n<p> </p>\n<ul type=\"disc\"> \n <li class=\"MsoNormal\"><span style=\"line-height: 115%;\" lang=\"EN\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">Under RN supervision, collects vital signs, intake and output, weights and other measurements as delegated. Assists patient with, or performs, daily AM &amp; HS Care per standards. Assists the RN with bathing, turning, activity support, ambulating, comfort and skin care for patients. Assists patients as needed with toileting at least every two (2) hours and remains with patients who appear unsteady. Assembles supplies and equipment needed for patient care as directed by RN. Demonstrates competency in ADLs, activity support, and clerical duties. Other competencies as defined by unit.\n    <o:p></o:p></font></span></li> \n <li class=\"MsoNormal\"><span style=\"line-height: 115%;\" lang=\"EN\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">Maintains a clean, safe environment, including patient rooms, unit common areas, and hallways. Demonstrates awareness and prevention of potential safety hazards to include making sure patient is properly identified, patient care items are labeled, and that the call light and bedside table are within the patient's reach at all times.\n    <o:p></o:p></font></span></li> \n <li class=\"MsoNormal\"><span style=\"line-height: 115%;\" lang=\"EN\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">Introduces self to the patients and families and explains title/function at the start of each shift. Interacts with patients and visitors through friendly and helpful communications. Responds in a timely and respectful manner to patient and/or family requests.\n    <o:p></o:p></font></span></li> \n <li class=\"MsoNormal\"><span style=\"line-height: 115%;\" lang=\"EN\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">Reports timely, accurate and pertinent information to RNs throughout the shift and at end of shift. Immediately reports any abnormal findings or changes in patient condition to the RN. Documents patient information in an accurate and timely manner (patient's VS, I&amp;O, weights, restraints and care) in all required areas to include updating of activity boards.\n    <o:p></o:p></font></span></li> \n <li class=\"MsoNormal\"><span style=\"line-height: 115%;\" lang=\"EN\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">Transports patients to and from procedures as appropriate. Performs clerical duties and communications related to admission, transfer, death and discharge of patients. Maintains unit log or patient tracking system.\n    <o:p></o:p></font></span></li> \n</ul> \n<p> </p>\n<p class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\"><b>Requirements</b> (education, licensures, certification)\n  <o:p></o:p></font></p> \n<p> </p>\n<ul type=\"disc\"> \n <li class=\"MsoNormal\"><span style=\"line-height: 115%;\" lang=\"EN\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">Minimum Education: High School Diploma or GED\n    <o:p></o:p></font></span></li> \n <li class=\"MsoNormal\"><span style=\"line-height: 115%;\" lang=\"EN\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">Req. Certification/Registration/License: Certified by the State of Colorado to practice as a CNA or current certification as EMT.\n    <o:p></o:p></font></span></li> \n</ul> \n<p> </p>\n<p class=\"MsoListParagraph\" style=\"text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2;  tab-stops:list .5in\">\n <!--[if !supportLists]--><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\"><span style=\"line-height: 115%;\">·<span style=\"font-stretch: normal; line-height: normal;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span>\n  <!--[endif]-->BLS through the American Heart Association or the American Red Cross CPR for the Professional Rescuer with card in-hand before start date.&nbsp; BLS or CPR card must be good through sixty days of hire.&nbsp; All life support certification cards must be issued by either the American Heart Association or the American Red Cross CPR for the Professional Rescuer. (American Red Cross for the Professional Rescuer is only good upon hire and all renewals will need to be through an American Heart Association sanctioned course.)\n  <o:p></o:p></font></p> \n<p> </p>\n<p class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt\"><b><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">Preferred\n   <o:p></o:p></font></b></p> \n<p> </p>\n<ul type=\"disc\"> \n <li class=\"MsoNormal\"><span style=\"line-height: 115%;\" lang=\"EN\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">Minimum Experience: 3-12 Months direct experience\n    <o:p></o:p></font></span></li> \n</ul> \n<p> </p>\n<p class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">&nbsp;</font></p> \n<p> </p>\n<p class=\"MsoNormalCxSpMiddle\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">With award-winning hospitals and facilities serving the entire Front Range, University of Colorado Health is the state's largest and most innovative health system. By integrating the strengths of academic medicine with the finest community health care, we're able to push the boundaries of medicine and offer our employees endless career opportunities. Here, there are no limits, except those you place on yourself. Everyone is united by their passion for discovery and their commitment to improving patients' lives.\n  <o:p></o:p></font></p> \n<p> </p>\n<p class=\"MsoNormalCxSpMiddle\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">&nbsp;</font></p> \n<p> </p>\n<p class=\"MsoNormalCxSpMiddle\"><b><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">Join Us. {"actual":"","id":"56a0b856e4b0c1bb93610fd0","key":"<p class=\"MsoPlainText\"><b><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">Elevating the Possibility of U at UCHealth \n   <o:p></o:p></font></b></p> \n<p> </p>\n<p class=\"MsoPlainText\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">&nbsp;</font></p> \n<p> </p>\n<p class=\"MsoPlainText\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">UCHealth is a special place and it requires a special type of person to work here. We are committed to attracting exceptional people who possess a rare combination of talent, drive, and intellectual curiosity. They are the people who naturally gravitate toward our culture, our geography, and our passion for discovery -- ambitious people for whom UCHealth isn't just a career, but an elevated state of mind.\n  <o:p></o:p></font></p> \n<p> </p>\n<p class=\"MsoPlainText\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">&nbsp;</font></p> \n<p> </p>\n<p class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt\"><b><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">Summary:\n   <o:p></o:p></font></b></p> \n<p> </p>\n<p class=\"MsoPlainText\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\"><span lang=\"EN\">Under RN supervision, functions to assist the nursing staffing diversified duties in the delivery of patient care and support activities. Collaborates with other members of the patient care team to promote holistic patient care. Must demonstrate competency in all of the following: collection and documentation of vital signs, intakes and outputs, weights, and other measurements as delegated; activities of daily living; activity support and clerical duties. May also be required to demonstrate competency in any of the following as defined by specific unit: POCT, set-up/assist with procedures, phlebotomy, tube feedings, vital records, and retail sales. May also be required to demonstrate competency in any of the following, as defined by the specific critical care unit: collection and documentation of weights, intake and output, and other measurements; phlebotomy, spinal immobilization, POCT, EKG monitoring, performing 12 lead EKGs, set-up/assist with procedures, and tube feedings. Reports timely, accurate and pertinent information to RNs throughout the shift. Performs order entry/transcription, maintains medical records, maintains supplies and equipment, and ensures unit-specific patient charges. May be utilized as a core trainer in the orientation of new staff.</span>\n  <o:p></o:p></font></p> \n<p> </p>\n<p class=\"MsoPlainText\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">&nbsp;</font></p> \n<p> </p>\n<p class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt\"><b><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">Job duties:\n   <o:p></o:p></font></b></p> \n<p> </p>\n<ul type=\"disc\"> \n <li class=\"MsoNormal\"><span style=\"line-height: 115%;\" lang=\"EN\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">Under RN supervision, collects vital signs, intake and output, weights and other measurements as delegated. Assists patient with, or performs, daily AM &amp; HS Care per standards. Assists the RN with bathing, turning, activity support, ambulating, comfort and skin care for patients. Assists patients as needed with toileting at least every two (2) hours and remains with patients who appear unsteady. Assembles supplies and equipment needed for patient care as directed by RN. Demonstrates competency in ADLs, activity support, and clerical duties. Other competencies as defined by unit.\n    <o:p></o:p></font></span></li> \n <li class=\"MsoNormal\"><span style=\"line-height: 115%;\" lang=\"EN\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">Maintains a clean, safe environment, including patient rooms, unit common areas, and hallways. Demonstrates awareness and prevention of potential safety hazards to include making sure patient is properly identified, patient care items are labeled, and that the call light and bedside table are within the patient's reach at all times.\n    <o:p></o:p></font></span></li> \n <li class=\"MsoNormal\"><span style=\"line-height: 115%;\" lang=\"EN\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">Introduces self to the patients and families and explains title/function at the start of each shift. Interacts with patients and visitors through friendly and helpful communications. Responds in a timely and respectful manner to patient and/or family requests.\n    <o:p></o:p></font></span></li> \n <li class=\"MsoNormal\"><span style=\"line-height: 115%;\" lang=\"EN\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">Reports timely, accurate and pertinent information to RNs throughout the shift and at end of shift. Immediately reports any abnormal findings or changes in patient condition to the RN. Documents patient information in an accurate and timely manner (patient's VS, I&amp;O, weights, restraints and care) in all required areas to include updating of activity boards.\n    <o:p></o:p></font></span></li> \n <li class=\"MsoNormal\"><span style=\"line-height: 115%;\" lang=\"EN\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">Transports patients to and from procedures as appropriate. Performs clerical duties and communications related to admission, transfer, death and discharge of patients. Maintains unit log or patient tracking system.\n    <o:p></o:p></font></span></li> \n</ul> \n<p> </p>\n<p class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\"><b>Requirements</b> (education, licensures, certification)\n  <o:p></o:p></font></p> \n<p> </p>\n<ul type=\"disc\"> \n <li class=\"MsoNormal\"><span style=\"line-height: 115%;\" lang=\"EN\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">Minimum Education: High School Diploma or GED\n    <o:p></o:p></font></span></li> \n <li class=\"MsoNormal\"><span style=\"line-height: 115%;\" lang=\"EN\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">Req. Certification/Registration/License: Certified by the State of Colorado to practice as a CNA or current certification as EMT.\n    <o:p></o:p></font></span></li> \n</ul> \n<p> </p>\n<p class=\"MsoListParagraph\" style=\"text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2;  tab-stops:list .5in\">\n <!--[if !supportLists]--><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\"><span style=\"line-height: 115%;\">·<span style=\"font-stretch: normal; line-height: normal;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span>\n  <!--[endif]-->BLS through the American Heart Association or the American Red Cross CPR for the Professional Rescuer with card in-hand before start date.&nbsp; BLS or CPR card must be good through sixty days of hire.&nbsp; All life support certification cards must be issued by either the American Heart Association or the American Red Cross CPR for the Professional Rescuer. (American Red Cross for the Professional Rescuer is only good upon hire and all renewals will need to be through an American Heart Association sanctioned course.)\n  <o:p></o:p></font></p> \n<p> </p>\n<p class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt\"><b><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">Preferred\n   <o:p></o:p></font></b></p> \n<p> </p>\n<ul type=\"disc\"> \n <li class=\"MsoNormal\"><span style=\"line-height: 115%;\" lang=\"EN\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">Minimum Experience: 3-12 Months direct experience\n    <o:p></o:p></font></span></li> \n</ul> \n<p> </p>\n<p class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">&nbsp;</font></p> \n<p> </p>\n<p class=\"MsoNormalCxSpMiddle\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">With award-winning hospitals and facilities serving the entire Front Range, University of Colorado Health is the state's largest and most innovative health system. By integrating the strengths of academic medicine with the finest community health care, we're able to push the boundaries of medicine and offer our employees endless career opportunities. Here, there are no limits, except those you place on yourself. Everyone is united by their passion for discovery and their commitment to improving patients' lives.\n  <o:p></o:p></font></p> \n<p> </p>\n<p class=\"MsoNormalCxSpMiddle\"><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">&nbsp;</font></p> \n<p> </p>\n<p class=\"MsoNormalCxSpMiddle\"><b><font face=\"arial, helvetica, sans-serif\" size=\"2\">Join Us. {"actual":"","id":"56a89bb603484ef4109858d6","key":"<p>City: Fayetteville</p><p>State: NC</p><p>Zip Code: 01234</p><p><b>Are you a Registered Nurse or Licensed Practical Nurse (RN or R.N. or LPN or L.P.N.) interested in one on one nursing in the home?&nbsp; Not sure if Per Diem homecare or home healthcare is for you? Take a few seconds, hit quick apply below and we’ll contact you today to help you decide if taking care of patients in their homes is for you.&nbsp;&nbsp;</b>Join PSA and experience what great hourly pay rates feel like, what the freedom of a truly flexible schedule feels like, what working close to your own home feels like, what getting back to true nursing (i.e. one-on-one care) feels like and what actually being appreciated by your homecare agency feels like.&nbsp;&nbsp;<b>PSA provides nurses with the very best pay, flexibility of shifts, shortest commutes, world class training, support and clinical resources, educational scholarships and benefits.</b></p><p><b>Job Responsibilities</b></p><p>As a Homecare Nurse, you will be delivering the highest quality patient care according to the specific orders of each patient's individual physician. Job responsibilities include but are not limited to:</p><ul><li>Patient Assessments</li><li>Administration of prescribed medication, treatments and therapies</li><li>Care planning</li><li>Communication with other members of the patients' multi-disciplinary team</li><li>Supply management</li><li>Emergency management</li><li>Coordination of care</li><li>Health promotion and teaching</li><li>Training of family members</li></ul><p></p><p></p><p></p><p></p><p></p><p></p><p></p><p>Specific qualifications for these roles include:</p><ul><li>Diploma, Associate' s or Bachelor's degree in nursing from a state accredited Registered Nurse or Licensed Practical Nurse (R.N. or RN or LPN or L.P.N.) program</li><li>Current and unrestricted Registered Nurse (RN) or Licensed Practical&nbsp; Nurse&nbsp;(LPN) license to practice in this state</li><li>Current Cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) certification</li><li>Current Continuing Education if required by state</li><li>Proof of eligibility to work in the United States</li><li>Ability to work independently and with minimal supervision</li><li>Physical ability to walk, lift, stand, bend, kneel, see, hear and talk clearly.</li></ul><p><b>Local Information</b></p><p>PSA Healthcare has a branch in Fayetteville and a strong need to fill cases in Sanford, Lumberton, and Wilmington as a result of overwhelming demand for our industry leading pediatric homecare services. If you are an RN or LPN interested in per diem job opportunities in and around the greater Fayetteville area we want to talk to you immediately.&nbsp; We have patients that need you today in these and many more areas. Whether you’re looking for weekday day time hours or weekend night time hours or any combination of the above, we’ve got the work you’re looking for, apply now!</p><p>PSA Healthcare hires and trains the very best per diem nurses, Registered Nurses (RN), Licensed Practical Nurses (LPN) and Licensed Vocational Nurses (LVNs) in the homecare, home care and home healthcare industry. For more than 30 years, our patients and nurses have rated PSA with the very best satisfaction scores. We provide care to both pediatric and adult private duty nursing and visit patients; they need your help and care today. Many of PSA’s patients have a tracheostomy and require a trach to breathe.&nbsp; Some require a vent or ventilator to breathe too.&nbsp; Other patients may have a g-tube or gastronomy tube or some combination of all of the above. &nbsp;We will train you and orient you to the patient that best fits your skill and confidence level and who’s location and schedule best fits your preference for travel and working hours. PSA is known nationally as the leading Pediatric provider of home care nursing services to medically fragile children and we are particularly well known for our care of children with Neurological, Respiratory and Pulmonary disorders such as Cystic Fibrosis (CF), Cerebral Palsy (CP), Bronchopulmonary Dysplasia (BPD), Cardiac complexities and many others.&nbsp; PSA works closely with the nation’s leading Children’s Hospitals to coordinate care for our patients. We also provide Private Duty Nursing (PDN) and Visit Nursing services to a great many Adult patients in their homes too.</p><p>To search all of our available opportunities, visit&nbsp;<b>http://www.psa.jobs&nbsp;</b></p><p>If you'd like to learn more about PSA Healthcare, including some of the benefits available to our employees, check out our website at&nbsp;<a href=\"http://www.psahealthcare.com\" target=\"_blank\"><b>http://www.psahealthcare.com</b></a></p><p><b>*CB</b></p>"}

Occasional lifting, carrying, pushing, or pulling up to 50 lbs. Must be able to see and hear to monitor lights, sounds and alarms on equipment.&nbsp; Must have sufficient strength and manual dexterity to safely operate equipment, including grasping and manipulating small objects. Must be able to discern changes in temperature or texture by touch. Must be able to respond to emergency situations. This may require physical strength, agility, and ability to function under stressful circumstances. Must be able to function in a wide variety of environments which may involve exposure to communicable disease, latex, or other sources of allergic response and that cannot always be controlled by the employer.</p>"}

Through the healthcare and scientific associations and societies they support, our people help enhance patient outcomes and advance professions and new discoveries that save and improve lives. We have been in business 30 years and count among our clients some of the most prestigious associations in the U.S. We offer competitive compensation plans, profit sharing and bonuses. The Townsend Group is a wholly owned subsidiary of SmithBucklin.</p><p> </p><p><strong>About SmithBucklin</strong></p><p> </p><p>SmithBucklin is the association management and services company more organizations turn to than any other. Our mission is to achieve the missions of the client organizations we serve and provide uncompromised stewardship for their long-term prosperity. SmithBucklin offers full-service management and outsourced services to trade associations, professional societies, technology user communities, industry consortia, charitable organizations, corporations and government institutes. Founded in 1949, SmithBucklin has offices in Chicago, Washington D.C., Old Lyme, Conn., St. Louis, Bethesda, Md., and San Ramon, Calif., and delivers seamless association and event management services worldwide. The company is 100 percent employee-owned. Abilities:</strong></p><ul><li>Exemplary internal and external customer service</li><li>Able to manage multiple projects with competing timelines</li><li>Great organization and communication skills</li><li>Team player who thrives in a deadline driven business</li><li>Proficiency with all Microsoft Office</li></ul><p>                                                                                          </p><p><strong>Education &amp; Work Experience Required:</strong></p><ul><li>Preference given to candidates with event planning or CME experience</li><li>Bachelor's degree</li></ul><p> </p><p><strong>Where do you fit?</strong></p><p> </p><p>Whether you are just beginning your career or are a mid- or senior-level professional, working at SmithBucklin will offer you countless opportunities to develop transferrable skills, acquire meaningful knowledge and gain rich experiences at an accelerated pace. By working collaboratively with smart, ambitious, multi-talented, genuine and hardworking colleagues, you will build meaningful, deep and enduring relationships that will serve you well throughout your career, regardless of your chosen path. In addition, our unique environment provides exposure to and engagement with accomplished and influential industry leaders who serve on their respective association's board of directors or committees.</p><p> </p><p>Our people make a meaningful difference in a wide range of diverse industries and professions, helping our client organizations achieve their missions and generate more opportunities for their stakeholders. For the trade and professional associations they serve, our people advocate for businesses and industries, help create and protect jobs, and increase product and workplace safety. Through the healthcare and scientific associations and societies they support, our people help enhance patient outcomes and advance professions and new discoveries that save and improve lives. And in their work with technology user communities and associations, our people help increase the reach and impact of high-tech solutions that are changing the ways people, businesses and future generations operate, interact and achieve new successes.</p><p> </p><p>In addition, as a 100 percent employee-owned company, SmithBucklin offers all of our people - regardless of position or compensation - an equal chance to experience the fulfillment and reap the benefits of ownership. As owners, our employees control the destiny of SmithBucklin and are unified in the goal of building a great, enduring company.</p><p> </p><p><strong>About The France Foundation</strong></p><p> </p><p>Since its inception in 1999, The France Foundation has been at the forefront of planning, developing, and implementing multidisciplinary accredited medical education. TFF specializes in curriculum-based education and in educational collaborations that improve providers' knowledge, competence, and practical performance to ultimately improve the care practices provide. The France Foundation is accredited with commendation by the ACCME (Accreditation Council for Continuing Medical Education) and by the ACPE (Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education) to provide CME credit for physicians and pharmacists respectively.</p><p> </p><p><strong>About SmithBucklin</strong></p><p> </p><p>SmithBucklin is the association management and services company more organizations turn to than any other. Our mission is to achieve the missions of the client organizations we serve and provide uncompromised stewardship for their long-term prosperity. SmithBucklin offers full-service management and outsourced services to trade associations, professional societies, technology user communities, industry consortia, charitable organizations, corporations and government institutes. Founded in 1949, SmithBucklin has offices in Chicago, Washington D.C., Old Lyme, Conn., St. Louis, Bethesda, Md., and San Ramon, Calif., and delivers seamless association and event management services worldwide. The company is 100 percent employee-owned. For more information, please visit www.smithbucklin.com or call 1-800-539-9740.</p><p> </p><p><strong>Equal Employment Opportunity </strong></p><p> </p><p>At SmithBucklin Corporation, Equal Employment Opportunity is our commitment and goal. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, gender, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, marital status or any other protected status designated by federal, state or local law. Applicants are encouraged to confidentially self-identify when applying. Employment is contingent upon successful completion of a reference and background investigation based on position.</p> \n\t\t\t\t\t</td>\n\t\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t</tr>\n\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t</tbody></table>"}

In addition, our unique environment provides exposure to and engagement with accomplished and influential industry leaders who serve on their respective association's board of directors or committees.</p><p> </p><p>Our people make a meaningful difference in a wide range of diverse industries and professions, helping our client organizations achieve their missions and generate more opportunities for their stakeholders. For the trade and professional associations they serve, our people advocate for businesses and industries, help create and protect jobs, and increase product and workplace safety. Through the healthcare and scientific associations and societies they support, our people help enhance patient outcomes and advance professions and new discoveries that save and improve lives. And in their work with technology user communities and associations, our people help increase the reach and impact of high-tech solutions that are changing the ways people, businesses and future generations operate, interact and achieve new successes.</p><p> </p><p>In addition, as a 100 percent employee-owned company, SmithBucklin offers all of our people - regardless of position or compensation - an equal chance to experience the fulfillment and reap the benefits of ownership. As owners, our employees control the destiny of SmithBucklin and are unified in the goal of building a great, enduring company.</p><p> </p><p><strong>TBU:</strong></p><p> </p><p>The<strong> </strong>Technology Industry Practice<strong> </strong>is<strong> </strong>the nation's leading provider of management services to technology-focused organizations with more than 30 years of cumulative experience partnering with leading technology associations.  We are the only association management company with an entire practice area devoted to technology-oriented communities and have a wealth of experience on trending and best practices. Seasoned Technology Industry Practice professionals partner with full-service client organizations or standalone technology user groups to define success and growth targets for their organizations. On that solid foundation, we build good governance practices, develop strategic plans, operational excellence targets, improve their financial practices, and ultimately grow their organizations-congruent with their goals and timelines.</p><p> </p><p><strong>About SmithBucklin</strong></p><p> </p><p>SmithBucklin is the association management and services company more organizations turn to than any other. Our mission is to achieve the missions of the client organizations we serve and provide uncompromised stewardship for their long-term prosperity. SmithBucklin offers full-service management and outsourced services to trade associations, professional societies, technology user communities, industry consortia, charitable organizations, corporations and government institutes. Founded in 1949, SmithBucklin has offices in Chicago, Washington D.C., Old Lyme, Conn., St. Louis, Bethesda, Md., and San Ramon, Calif., and delivers seamless association and event management services worldwide. The company is 100 percent employee-owned. For more information, please visit www.smithbucklin.com or call 1-800-539-9740.</p><p> </p><p><strong>Equal Employment Opportunity </strong></p><p> </p><p>At SmithBucklin Corporation, Equal Employment Opportunity is our commitment and goal. As owners, our employees control the destiny of SmithBucklin and are unified in the goal of building a great, enduring company.</p><p> </p><p><strong>About SmithBucklin</strong></p><p> </p><p>SmithBucklin is the association management and services company more organizations turn to than any other. Our mission is to achieve the missions of the client organizations we serve and provide uncompromised stewardship for their long-term prosperity. SmithBucklin offers full-service management and outsourced services to trade associations, professional societies, technology user communities, industry consortia, charitable organizations, corporations and government institutes. Founded in 1949, SmithBucklin has offices in Chicago, Washington D.C., Old Lyme, Conn., St. Louis, Bethesda, Md., and San Ramon, Calif., and delivers seamless association and event management services worldwide. The company is 100 percent employee-owned. For more information, please visit www.smithbucklin.com or call 1-800-539-9740.</p><p> </p><p><strong>Equal Employment Opportunity </strong></p><p> </p><p>At SmithBucklin Corporation, Equal Employment Opportunity is our commitment and goal. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, gender, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, marital status or any other protected status designated by federal, state or local law. Applicants are encouraged to confidentially self-identify when applying. Act as technical expert to ensure development of high quality systems design solutions and train and coordinate technical teams of developers concerning administrative system implementation. The successful candidate will focus the development of an architectural vision for their infrastructure leveraging Cisco's Advanced Technology products, solutions and architectures. Such key Cisco technologies include:   <br>  &#9679; Data Centre (Nexus and UCS)  <br>  &#9679; Evolved Programmable Network (EPN)  <br>  &#9679; Evolved Services Platform (ESP)  <br>  &#9679; Mobility Solutions  <br>  &#9679; Software Defined Networking  <br>  <br>  The individual will work closely with the Account Team and Account Leadership to demonstrate the business value of Cisco Solutions, architectures and services by aligning opportunities with a 3-5 year architectural vision.  <br>  <br>  <b>Minimum Qualifications</b>  <br>  &#9679; In-depth knowledge in at least one following areas: Routing &amp; Switching, SP WiFi, Security, Unified Computing System, Data Centre &amp; Virtualization.  <br>  &#9679; Perform technical presentation  <br>  &#9679; Ability to engage and communicate with senior executives  <br>  &#9679; Assist in the development of sales proposals  <br>  &#9679; Skilled at Solution and Architectural Selling  <br>  &#9679; Exemplary customer skills and an ability to build consensus across a diverse group of teams  <br>  <br>  <b>Desired Skills</b>  <br>  &#9679; Expert level experience within the Canadian Service Provider Environment  <br>  &#9679; CCIE certification highly desirable and/or Industry Professional-level certification(s) preferred  <br>  &#9679; 10+ years customer facing pre-sales experience  <br>  <br>  <b>About Cisco</b>  <br>  The Internet of Everything is a phenomenon driving new opportunities for Cisco and it's transforming our customers' businesses worldwide. We are pioneers and have been since the early days of connectivity. Today, we are building teams that are expanding our technology solutions in the mobile, cloud, security, IT, and big data spaces, including software and consulting services. As Cisco delivers the network that powers the Internet, we are connecting the unconnected. Imagine creating unprecedented disruption. Your revolutionary ideas will impact everything from retail, healthcare, and entertainment, to public and private sectors, and far beyond. Collaborate with like-minded innovators in a fun and flexible culture that has earned Cisco global recognition as a Great Place To Work. Since 1984, Cisco has led in the innovation of several networking technologies such as routing, switching, security, unified communications, video, and wireless. Cisco continues to lead in new areas such as Cloud, Data Center, Virtualization, SDN, Internet of Things, etc&hellip; Our responsible business practices help ensure business sustainability and environmentally conscious operations and products.  <br>  Cisco is a $48 Billion dollar global leader in supplying leading edge, best-in-class networking products driving today's Internet. The company is ranked as one of the world's best employers and spends over $5 Billion dollars a year invested in R&amp;D. Cisco is a great place to grow your career.  <br>  <br>  The Team  <br>  <br>  The R&amp;D campus in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada is looking for experienced SW developers. You will be an active member of the Cloud &amp; Network Solutions software development team and contribute to the implementation, testing and customer delivery of state-of-the-art Cloud Network Automation &amp; Provisioning of Cisco Datacenter Network Infrastructure applications for the leading Private Cloud Management Platforms.  <br>  Minimum Qualifications  <br>  &bull; Bachelor or Master Degree in CS/EE, or equivalent experience is required. Any other demonstrated high technology aptitude is desired  <br>  &bull; Software development or software testing experience  <br>  &bull; Software development life cycle  <br>  &bull; Proficient with any of the following programming languages: C/C#/OOP, or scripting languages TCL/Python.  <br>  &bull; Proficient with Test Driven Development, Static analysis and Code Coverage  <br>  &bull; Source repositories such as Git&lt; GitLab or Git Hub  <br>  &bull; IDE Tools like Visual Studio, Eclipse etc  <br>  &bull; Excellent communication skills  <br>  <br>  Desirable Skills  <br>  &bull; Experience with Agile/Scrum process is highly desirable  <br>  &bull; Knowledge of network protocols and/or routing protocols is highly desirable  <br>  &bull; Experience with Multi-threading and Network Programming  <br>  &bull; Knowledge of CloudManagement Platforms, Windows Azure Pack, Open Stack, VMWare vCloud Director or vCenter  <br>  &bull; Knowledge of Server Virtualization Plaforms: Microsoft Hyper-V, VMWare ESXi, RHEL KVM  <br>  &bull; Direct experience with Linux and related infrastructure software  <br>  <br>  About Cisco  <br>  The Internet of Everything is a phenomenon driving new opportunities for Cisco and it's transforming our customers' businesses worldwide. We are pioneers and have been since the early days of connectivity. Today, we are building teams that are expanding our technology solutions in the mobile, cloud, security, IT, and big data spaces, including software and consulting services. As Cisco delivers the network that powers the Internet, we are connecting the unconnected. Imagine creating unprecedented disruption. Your revolutionary ideas will impact everything from retail, healthcare, and entertainment, to public and private sectors, and far beyond. Collaborate with like-minded innovators in a fun and flexible culture that has earned Cisco global recognition as a Great place to Work. With roughly 10 billion connected things in the world now and over 50 billion estimated in the future, your career has exponential possibilities at Cisco.  <br>  <br>  Lieu de travail : Ottawa (Kanata), Ontario, Canada  <br>  <br>  L&rsquo;entit&eacute; commerciale  <br>  <br>  Cisco est le chef de file mondial des r&eacute;seaux qui transforment les fa&ccedil;ons dont les gens se connectent, communiquent et collaborent. Depuis 1984, Cisco est le chef de file de l&rsquo;innovation en mati&egrave;re de technologies de r&eacute;seaux bas&eacute;es sur les protocoles IP, comme le routage, la commutation, la s&eacute;curit&eacute;, les communications unifi&eacute;es, la vid&eacute;o et les communications sans fil. Cisco continue d&rsquo;&ecirc;tre le chef de file dans de nouveaux domaines comme l&rsquo;infonuagique, les centres de donn&eacute;es, la virtualisation, les r&eacute;seaux d&eacute;finis par logiciel (SDN), l&rsquo;Internet des objets, etc. Nos pratiques d&rsquo;affaires socialement responsables permettent d&rsquo;assurer la p&eacute;rennit&eacute; des activit&eacute;s et des produits, et ce, dans le respect de l&rsquo;environnement.  <br>  Cisco est un chef de file mondial de 48 milliards de dollars qui offre les produits de r&eacute;seau &agrave; la fine pointe qui alimentent l&rsquo;Internet d&rsquo;aujourd&rsquo;hui. La soci&eacute;t&eacute; est l&rsquo;un des meilleurs employeurs au monde; elle investit plus de 5 milliards de dollars par an en recherche et d&eacute;veloppement. Cisco offre un lieu de choix o&ugrave; d&eacute;velopper sa carri&egrave;re.  <br>  <br>  L&rsquo;&eacute;quipe  <br>  <br>  Le centre canadien de R et D situ&eacute; &agrave; Ottawa en Ontario est &agrave; la recherche de d&eacute;veloppeurs de logiciels exp&eacute;riment&eacute;s. Le candidat retenu sera un membre actif de l&rsquo;&eacute;quipe de d&eacute;veloppement de logiciels et contribuera &agrave; la mise en &oelig;uvre, aux tests et &agrave; la livraison d&rsquo;applications et de services d&rsquo;avant-garde des plans de contr&ocirc;le et de donn&eacute;es notamment des protocoles tels que les protocoles de routage IPv4 et IPv6, MPLS, L2VPN/VPLS et de r&eacute;seaux de diffusion de contenu (CDN) fond&eacute;s sur des architectures de r&eacute;seaux d&eacute;finis par logiciel (SDN) et de r&eacute;seaux virtualis&eacute;s. Qualifications minimales  <br>  &bull; Baccalaur&eacute;at ou ma&icirc;trise en science informatique ou g&eacute;nie &eacute;lectrique ou informatique, ou une exp&eacute;rience &eacute;quivalente exig&eacute;s Toute autre comp&eacute;tence d&eacute;montr&eacute;e en haute technologie est recherch&eacute;e  <br>  &bull; Exp&eacute;rience de d&eacute;veloppement logiciel  <br>  &bull; Expert du d&eacute;veloppement logiciel en utilisant Java, Python, Net Connaissance des fichiers Makefile, de l&rsquo;analyse statique et des d&eacute;p&ocirc;ts distants Habitu&eacute; de travailler avec des outils tels que Visual Studio etc.  <br>  &bull; Excellentes aptitudes de communication  <br>  <br>  Comp&eacute;tences recherch&eacute;es  <br>  Exp&eacute;rience des m&eacute;thodologies Agile/Scrum, un atout certain  <br>  &bull; Exp&eacute;rience dans la conception de syst&egrave;mes de commutation et de routage  <br>  &bull; Exp&eacute;rience des protocoles des couches 2 et 3 Connaissance pratique des protocoles de mise en r&eacute;seau TCP/IP  <br>  &bull; Connaissance des technologies r&eacute;seau dont MPLS, la multidiffusion, les RPV, la NAT, les analyses de qualit&eacute; de service, AAA, les DNS et le protocole DHCP  <br>  &bull; Connaissance des technologies de l&rsquo;infonuagique de SDN, de NFV et de la virtualisation du r&eacute;seau de virtualisation Virtualization  <br>  &bull; Exp&eacute;rience directe avec Linux et le logiciel connexe d&rsquo;infrastructure  <br>  <br>  <br>  &Agrave; propos de Cisco  <br>  <br>  L&rsquo;Internet multidimensionnel est un ph&eacute;nom&egrave;ne qui cr&eacute;e de nouveaux d&eacute;bouch&eacute;s pour Cisco et qui transforme les activit&eacute;s de nos clients dans le monde entier. Nous sommes des pionniers et nous l&rsquo;avons &eacute;t&eacute; d&egrave;s les d&eacute;buts de la connectivit&eacute;. Aujourd&rsquo;hui, nous mettons sur pied des &eacute;quipes qui &eacute;toffent nos solutions technologiques dans les domaines de la mobilit&eacute;, de l&rsquo;infonuagique, de la s&eacute;curit&eacute;, des technologies de l&rsquo;information et du traitement des donn&eacute;es volumineuses, y compris les logiciels et les services-conseils. &Agrave; mesure que Cisco fournit les solutions de r&eacute;seau qui optimisent l&rsquo;Internet, nous relions entre eux les &eacute;l&eacute;ments qui ne l&rsquo;&eacute;taient pas auparavant. Imaginez si vous pouviez cr&eacute;er des id&eacute;es qui changent le monde! Vos id&eacute;es porteuses auront une incidence sur des domaines aussi vari&eacute;s que le commerce de d&eacute;tail, les secteurs de la sant&eacute; et du divertissement, en passant par les secteurs publics et priv&eacute;s et bien d&rsquo;autres. Collaborez avec des gens tourn&eacute;s vers l&rsquo;innovation dans un environnement stimulant et une culture d&rsquo;entreprise souple qui ont permis &agrave; Cisco d&rsquo;&ecirc;tre reconnue pour son milieu de travail exceptionnel. Environ 10 milliards d&rsquo;objets sont actuellement connect&eacute;s &agrave; l&rsquo;&eacute;chelle mondiale et il est pr&eacute;vu que plus de 50 milliards d&rsquo;objets le seront dans le futur. C&rsquo;est pourquoi au sein de Cisco, vous disposerez d&rsquo;un nombre exponentiel de possibilit&eacute;s d&rsquo;avancement.   <br>  <br>  *LI-EMEA-DO1 </td></tr><tr><td>&nbsp;</td></tr><tr height=20><td><b>Job Type: </b>Experienced</td></tr><tr height=20><td><b>Opportunity Category: </b>*None</td></tr></table>"}

We are transforming the way global organizations and government agencies manage and minimize network security risk. Our IPS and real-time adaptive security solutions provide security for the real world of dynamic networks and escalating threats. Today, the names Sourcefire, Snort and Cisco have grown synonymous with innovation and Cyber Security.  <br>  <br>  <b>The Team</b>  <br>  Sourcefire, now a Cisco company, is a dynamic environment that inspires employees to create opportunities by honing their talents and skills every day. Employees are self-motivated, results driven and engaged. We recognize and reward quality results and commitment to our company&rsquo;s purposes and principles. We are looking for a talented Software Engineer/Tester to be part of the UI team.   <br>  <br>  <b>Role &amp; Responsibilities</b>  <br>  &#9679; Design, develop, and maintain the user interface used for configuring Cisco&rsquo;s award winning network security appliances.  <br>  &#9679; Assist in debugging real world deployment issues.  <br>  &#9679; Work diligently to ensure that the user interface is as streamlined as possible.  <br>  &#9679; Work with a team of highly motivated UI developers to provide simple configuration interfaces to challenging problems.  <br>  &#9679; Assist with scoping and documenting feature designs.&#9679; Experience with automated UI testing and Agile Dev/Test teamwork.  <br>  <br>  <b>Minimum Qualifications</b>  <br>  &#9679; Bachelors degree in Computer Science or equivalent professional experience  <br>  &#9679; Perl &amp; Java programming experience.  <br>  &#9679; Experience with writing software on a Unix/Linux platform.  <br>  &#9679; Experience with the LAMP stack  <br>  &#9679; Ability to work independently or as part of a team.  <br>  &#9679; Strong problem solving skills.  <br>  &#9679; Driven to dig into a problem and find the core issues.  <br>  &#9679; Ability to communicate complicated technical issues in a clear and concise manner.  <br>  &#9679; Experience in software design and human interaction.   <br>  <br>  <b>Desired Skills</b>  <br>  &#9679; Experience with GWT strongly desired.  <br>  &#9679; SQL  <br>  &#9679; Familiarity with Network Security concepts  <br>  &#9679; Familiarity with Agile concepts.  <br>  &#9679; IP Networking  <br>  &#9679; CVS experience  <br>  &#9679; Familiarity with Eclipse  <br>  <br>  <b>About Cisco</b>  <br>  The Internet of Everything is a phenomenon driving new opportunities for Cisco and it's transforming our customers' businesses worldwide. We are pioneers and have been since the early days of connectivity. Today, we are building teams that are expanding our technology solutions in the mobile, cloud, security, IT, and big data spaces, including software and consulting services. As Cisco delivers the network that powers the Internet, we are connecting the unconnected. Imagine creating unprecedented disruption. Your revolutionary ideas will impact everything from retail, healthcare, and entertainment, to public and private sectors, and far beyond. Collaborate with like-minded innovators in a fun and flexible culture that has earned Cisco global recognition as a Great Place To Work. With roughly 10 billion connected things in the world now and over 50 billion estimated in the future, your career has exponential possibilities at Cisco.  <br>  <br>  <br>  @CiscoCareers #CiscoJobs #Sourcefire #Java #GWT #SoftwareEngineer  <br></td></tr><tr><td>&nbsp;</td></tr><tr height=20><td><b>Job Type: </b>Experienced</td></tr><tr height=20><td><b>Opportunity Category: </b>Security</td></tr></table>"}

Our RSMs will sell and insure best in class merchandising to include building displays, packing out product, and replenishing permanent secondary displays and maintain salability of all authorized Hershey Items.</span></span></p> \n<p>&nbsp;</p> \n<p><span style=\"font-size:12.0px\"><span style=\"font-family:arial, helvetica, sans-serif\"><em>This position is considered “Continuous Part-Time” &nbsp;working 20-25 hours per week on a regular schedule of Monday – Thursday, 9am – 2pm.&nbsp;&nbsp; On average, an RSM will visit between 6-10+ accounts per day.&nbsp; No car allowance is provided; however, mileage for travel will be reimbursed at 53 cents per mile.&nbsp; </em></span></span></p> \n<p>&nbsp;</p> \n<p><span style=\"font-size:12.0px\"><span style=\"font-family:arial, helvetica, sans-serif\">A RSM earns&nbsp;no less than $13.50 per hour to start plus a 2% annual cash bonus target, 401k and paid vacation.</span></span></p> \n<p>&nbsp;</p> \n<p><span style=\"font-size:12.0px\"><span style=\"font-family:arial, helvetica, sans-serif\"><strong>Major Duties/Responsibilities:</strong></span></span></p> \n<ul> \n <li><span style=\"font-size:12.0px\"><span style=\"font-family:arial, helvetica, sans-serif\">Sell and maintain 100% distribution of all “authorized” Hershey Items in assigned territory.&nbsp; Ensuring flawless retail execution of Headquarter Sales and Merchandising Plans (Retail Execution Plan) with various retailers.</span></span></li> \n <li><span style=\"font-size:12.0px\"><span style=\"font-family:arial, helvetica, sans-serif\">Achieve all merchandising objectives through the effective use of Permanent Secondary Displays and other display vehicles established within the Retail Execution Plan</span></span></li> \n <li><span style=\"font-size:12.0px\"><span style=\"font-family:arial, helvetica, sans-serif\">Reporting of weekly activity, expenses, competitive activity, account changes, promotions and all administrative functions within assigned territory.</span></span></li> \n <li><span style=\"font-size:12.0px\"><span style=\"font-family:arial, helvetica, sans-serif\">Reporting of Daily activities through the use of tablets, submitting upon completion of each day.</span></span></li> \n <li><span style=\"font-size:12.0px\"><span style=\"font-family:arial, helvetica, sans-serif\">Responsible for Sales Territory - Varies due to territory size, number of retailers, and location.</span></span></li> \n</ul> \n<p>&nbsp;</p> \n<p><span style=\"font-size:12.0px\"><span style=\"font-family:arial, helvetica, sans-serif\"><strong>Qualifications:</strong></span></span></p> \n<ul> \n <li><span style=\"font-size:12.0px\"><span style=\"font-family:arial, helvetica, sans-serif\">Must have a valid US state issued driver’s license</span></span></li> \n <li><span style=\"font-size:12.0px\"><span style=\"font-family:arial, helvetica, sans-serif\">Must have a personal vehicle in sound operating condition</span></span></li> \n <li><span style=\"font-size:12.0px\"><span style=\"font-family:arial, helvetica, sans-serif\">Must maintain personal auto insurance indicating minimum coverage of $300,000 per person / $300,000 per accident / $100,000 property damage. The position also requires that you name The Hershey Company as an additional insured, or interested party, on your policy PRIOR to the date of hire.</span></span></li> \n <li><span style=\"font-size:12.0px\"><span style=\"font-family:arial, helvetica, sans-serif\">Must reside within the territory boundaries as listed in the job description</span></span></li> \n <li><span style=\"font-size:12.0px\"><span style=\"font-family:arial, helvetica, sans-serif\">Must be able to drive long distances to make multiple sales calls on a daily basis</span></span></li> \n <li><span style=\"font-size:12.0px\"><span style=\"font-family:arial, helvetica, sans-serif\">Must be able to lift 10-40 lbs. on a regular basis with or without reasonable accommodations</span></span></li> \n <li><span style=\"font-size:12.0px\"><span style=\"font-family:arial, helvetica, sans-serif\">Must be able to bend, kneel, stoop down and demonstrate manual dexterity on a frequent basis with or without reasonable accommodations</span></span></li> \n <li><span style=\"font-size:12.0px\"><span style=\"font-family:arial, helvetica, sans-serif\">Must be able to use tablet technology</span></span></li> \n <li><span style=\"font-size:12.0px\"><span style=\"font-family:arial, helvetica, sans-serif\">Must have daily access to wireless internet</span></span></li> \n <li><span style=\"font-size:12.0px\"><span style=\"font-family:arial, helvetica, sans-serif\">Must have flexibility and adaptability to changes in territory coverage</span></span></li> \n <li><span style=\"font-size:12.0px\"><span style=\"font-family:arial, helvetica, sans-serif\">Availability to work 20-25 hours per week.
